global_deixis.audience: Donor governments, UN agencies, and international NGOs

entity.description: Unspecified water supply project described in the document.
People displaced from Zambezia, Sofala, and northern Tete.
Province in Mozambique.
Province in Mozambique.
Province in Mozambique.
Neighboring state used as transit route.
District headquarters and transit-camp location in Tete Province.
Municipality with transit camps.
Transit camps in Moatize.
Transit camps in Zobue.

actuality.verbatim: PROJECT MADE MORE URGENT BY CONTINUING INFLUX DISPLACED POPULATION FROM ZAMBEZIA, SOFALA AND NORTHERN TETE MAINLY VIA MALAWI, AND INTENTION TO RESETTLE LARGE NUMBER PEOPLE CURRENTLY IN TRANSIT CAMPS IN MOATIZE AND ZOBUE.
actuality.normalized: The project became more urgent due to the continuing influx of displaced people from Zambezia, Sofala, and northern Tete mainly via Malawi, and due to a plan to resettle many people currently in transit camps in Moatize and Zobue.

entity.description: District headquarters hosting increased population.

actuality.verbatim: NEED URGENT NOT ONLY RURAL AREAS BUT ALSO IN DISTRICT HEADQUARTERS OF SONGO AND MOATIZE WHICH ACCOMMODATING GREATLY INCREASED POPULATIONS.
actuality.normalized: Stakeholders urgently need support not only in rural areas but also in the district headquarters of Songo and Moatize, which are accommodating greatly increased populations.

entity.description: Government water-supply authority referenced in the document.
State drilling company with growing national capacity.
United Nations Children's Fund.
Province hosting UNICEF-supported well and borehole programme.
Operational model for province-level construction and maintenance infrastructure in a UNICEF-supported well and borehole programme.

actuality.verbatim: UDAAS AND GEOMOC (STATE DRILLING COMPANY) HAVE SMALL BUT GROWING NATIONAL CAPACITY AND DEVELOPED SUCCESSFUL MODEL FOR ESTABLISHMENT PROVINCE-LEVEL CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE INFRASTRUCTURE IN UNICEF-SUPPORTED WELL AND BOREHOLE PROGRAMME IN INHAMBANE PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: UDAAS and GEOMOC have a small but growing national capacity and have developed a successful model for establishing province-level construction and maintenance infrastructure in the UNICEF-supported well and borehole programme in Inhambane Province.

actuality.verbatim: PROJECT UNDER REFERENCE TO ENABLE INSTALLATION SIMILAR CAPACITY FOR TETE PROVINCE, AND TO COMMENCE WITH URGENT CONSTRUCTION/RECUPERATION OF UP TO 130 BOREHOLES OVER FIRST TWO YEARS PLUS SHALLOW WELLS WHERE FEASIBLE.
actuality.normalized: The project proposes enabling similar capacity for Tete Province and starting urgent construction and recuperation of up to 130 boreholes over the first two years, plus shallow wells where feasible.

actuality.verbatim: INDICATIVE NEEDS FOR PROJECTS INCLUDE TRANSPORT, WORKSHOP AND OFFICE EQUIPMENT, DRILLING RIGS, PUMPS, TOOLS, OTHER CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS, AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TEAM (HYDROGEOLOGIST, MASTER DRILLER, RIG MECHANIC, GEOPHYSICIST).
actuality.normalized: The projects’ indicative needs include transport; workshop and office equipment; drilling rigs; pumps; tools; other construction materials; and a technical assistance team (hydrogeologist, master driller, rig mechanic, geophysicist).

actuality.verbatim: PART OF THIS AMOUNT NEEDED FOR SHORT-TERM PROJECT DESIGN ACTIVITY.
actuality.normalized: Stakeholders need to allocate part of the amount to short-term project design activity.

entity.primary_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)
entity.description: Water source construction and recovery effort in Sofala and Manica provinces.

actuality.verbatim: (B) WATER SOURCE CONSTRUCTION AND RECOVERY IN SOFALA AND MANICA PROVINCES TOTAL : US DLRS 700,000
actuality.normalized: The total for water source construction and recovery in Sofala and Manica Provinces is US$700,000.

participants.subject_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)

entity.description: Displaced people in Sofala and Manica provinces.
Relatively safe corridor incorporating road, rail, and oil pipeline from Zimbabwe to Beira Port.
Port at Beira.
Country connected to Beira by road, rail, and oil pipeline.

actuality.verbatim: SOFALA AND MANICA PROVINCES HAVE ESTIMATED TOTAL 545,000 DISPLACED PEOPLE MANY OF WHOM CONCENTRATED RELATIVELY SAFE 'BEIRA CORRIDOR' AREA, WHICH INCORPORATES ROAD, RAIL AND OIL PIPELINE FROM ZIMBABWE TO BEIRA PORT.
actuality.normalized: Sofala and Manica Provinces are estimated to host a total of 545,000 displaced people, many concentrated in the relatively safe ‘Beira Corridor’ area, which incorporates road, rail, and an oil pipeline from Zimbabwe to Beira Port.

actuality.verbatim: BOTH PROVINCES BADLY AFFECTED BY DROUGHT IN 1983/84 AND SUBSEQUENTLY BY INSURGENCY.
actuality.normalized: Both provinces were badly affected by drought in 1983/84 and subsequently by insurgency.

entity.description: Province in Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: EXCEPT IN CENTRAL AREAS, THESE PROVINCES CONTAIN LITTLE SHALLOW GROUNDWATER AND GENERALLY HAVE FEW RELIABLE WATER SOURCES.
actuality.normalized: Except in central areas, these provinces contain little shallow groundwater and generally have few reliable water sources.

entity.description: National government of Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: HIGH PRIORITY GIVEN BY GOM TO WATER SOURCE DEVELOPMENT IN AREAS WHERE SECURITY HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED AND WHERE LARGE NUMBER DISPLACED IN URGENT NEED RESETTLEMENT.
actuality.normalized: The Government of Mozambique gives high priority to developing water sources in areas where security has been established and where many displaced people urgently need resettlement.

participants.subject_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)

entity.description: UDAAS delegation based at Chimoio.
GEOMOC delegation in Beira.
Municipality in Manica Province.
Municipality hosting a GEOMOC delegation.

actuality.verbatim: FIRST AND IMMEDIATE PHASE TO ESTABLISH ENHANCED TECHNICAL AND OPERATIONAL CAPACITY FOR THESE PROVINCES, BASED ON EXISTING UDAAS DELEGATION AT CHIMOIO AND GEOMOC DELEGATION IN BEIRA WHICH HAVE EXISTING BUT OUTMODED RIGS.
actuality.normalized: The first and immediate phase will establish enhanced technical and operational capacity for these provinces, based on the existing UDAAS delegation at Chimoio and the GEOMOC delegation in Beira, which have existing but outmoded rigs.

actuality.verbatim: FUNDS REQUIRED FOR HYDROGEOLOGIST/PROJECT CO-ORDINATOR, NEW ROTARY DRILLING RIG WITH ACCESSORIES, SPARE PARTS AND TOOLS FOR EXISTING CABLE TOOL AND PERCUSSION RIGS AND PROCUREMENT OF MATERIALS (BOREHOLE CASING, SCREENS, CEMENT, FUEL, LUBRICANTS, ETC.).
actuality.normalized: The project requires funds for a hydrogeologist/project coordinator, a new rotary drilling rig with accessories, spare parts and tools for existing cable tool and percussion rigs, and procurement of materials (borehole casing, screens, cement, fuel, lubricants, etc.).

participants.subject_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)

actuality.verbatim: IMMEDIATE PHASE AIMS CONSTRUCT 50 NEW TUBEWELLS AND RECUPERATE 47 EXISTING ONES TO BENEFIT IMMEDIATELY OVER 48,500 RURAL PEOPLE.
actuality.normalized: The immediate phase aims to construct 50 new tubewells and recuperate 47 existing ones to benefit more than 48,500 rural people immediately.

participants.subject_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)

actuality.verbatim: PROJECT ALSO TO RESULT INCREASED INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITY TO MOUNT/SUPERVISE SHALLOW WELL DEVELOPMENT IN RESETTLEMENT VILLAGES USING COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION.
actuality.normalized: The project will also result in increased institutional capacity to mount and supervise shallow-well development in resettlement villages using community participation.

participants.subject_reference: Project B: Water source construction & recovery (Sofala & Manica)

entity.description: UNICEF-assisted resettlement project in southern Manica Province.
Corridor of villages between Manica and Chimoio.

actuality.verbatim: FIRST SUCH PROJECT DUE TO START EARLY 1987 IN UNICEF-ASSISTED ESPUNGABERA RESETTLEMENT PROJECT SOUTHERN MANICA PROVINCE, WITH EXPANSION TO NEW VILLAGES IN MANICA-CHIMOIO CORRIDOR WITHIN PLANNED UNICEF-ASSISTED INTEGRATED PROJECT FOR DISPLACED PEOPLE.
actuality.normalized: The first such project is due to start in early 1987 in the UNICEF-assisted Espungabera resettlement project in southern Manica Province, with expansion to new villages in the Manica–Chimoio corridor within a planned UNICEF-assisted integrated project for displaced people.

entity.primary_reference: Project C: Recovery of Tete City water supply
entity.description: Project to recover and expand Tete City water supply.
Provincial capital of Tete Province.

actuality.verbatim: (C) RECOVERY TETE CITY WATER SUPPLY TOTAL : US DLRS 600,000
actuality.normalized: The total for recovery of Tete City water supply is US$600,000.

participants.subject_reference: Project C: Recovery of Tete City water supply

actuality.verbatim: TETE IS ONE OF MOST WAR-AFFECTED PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: Tete is one of the most war-affected provinces.

actuality.verbatim: THERE AS BEEN A SUBSTANTIAL INFLUX DISPLACED PERSONS TO PROVINCIAL CAPITAL, TETE CITY, CAUSING 300 PERCENT INCREASE POPULATION IN LAST TWO YEARS.
actuality.normalized: There has been a substantial influx of displaced persons to the provincial capital, Tete City, causing a 300 percent population increase in the last two years.

entity.description: Urban water supply system serving Tete City and periphery.

actuality.verbatim: CITY AND PERIPHERY POPULATION DEPEND UPON WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM TOTALLY INADEQUATE FOR CURRENT NEEDS, WHILE AVAILABLE SURFACE WATER CONTAMINATED BY OPEN TOWN'S SEWERS.
actuality.normalized: The city and periphery population depend on a water supply system totally inadequate for current needs, while available surface water is contaminated by the town’s open sewers.

actuality.verbatim: PROJECT TO PROVIDE POPULATION WITH ACCESS TO RELIABLE SUPPLY SAFE WATER BY RECUPERATING EXISTING EQUIPMENT/DISTRIBUTION NETWORK AND BY EXPANDING SUPPLY, PARTICULARLY TO NEW COMMUNITIES ON PERIPHERY THRU BUILDING NEW PUMP STATION AND NEW DISTRIBUTION MAINS.
actuality.normalized: The project will provide the population with reliable safe-water access by recuperating the existing equipment and distribution network and by expanding supply—particularly to new communities on the periphery—through building a new pump station and new distribution mains.

participants.subject_reference: Project C: Recovery of Tete City water supply

actuality.verbatim: OF OVERALL COST THIS PROJECT, SOME US DLRS 150,000 REQUIRED FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN DESIGN, SUPERVISION AND TRAINING OF LOCAL MAINTENANCE/OPERATIONS STAFF.
actuality.normalized: Of the project’s overall cost, about US$150,000 is required for technical assistance in design, supervision, and training of local maintenance and operations staff.

participants.subject_reference: Project C: Recovery of Tete City water supply

entity.primary_reference: Project D: Strengthening central management capacity
entity.description: Technical assistance project to strengthen UDAAS central coordination and management.

actuality.verbatim: (D) STRENGTHENING CENTRAL MANAGEMENT CAPACITY TOTAL (TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE) : US DLRS 600,000
actuality.normalized: The total for strengthening central management capacity (technical assistance) is US$600,000.

participants.subject_reference: Project D: Strengthening central management capacity

actuality.verbatim: FOR EFFECTIVE CO-ORDINATION/MANAGEMENT/SUPERVISION NEW WATER SUPPLY PROJECTS IN MOST AFFECTED AREAS TETE, MANICA, SOFALA (PROJECTS A, B AND C, ABOVE) AND INHAMBANE PROVINCE (ON-GOING), ESSENTIAL THAT CENTRAL CO-ORDINATION AND MANAGEMENT CAPACITIES IN UDAAS BE STRENGTHENED.
actuality.normalized: To effectively coordinate, manage, and supervise new water-supply projects in the most affected areas—Tete, Manica, Sofala (Projects A, B, and C), and Inhambane (ongoing)—UDAAS central coordination and management capacities must be strengthened.

actuality.verbatim: HIGHEST PRIORITY AREAS INCLUDE: (I) TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT PROJECTS WITH MAJOR TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES IN SOURCE LOCATION, CONSTRUCTION OR MAINTENANCE, (II) LOGISTICAL AND ORGANIZATIONAL ASSISTANCE, AND (III) MONITORING AND SUPERVISION OF NEW PROJECTS.
actuality.normalized: Highest-priority areas include: (i) technical assistance to support projects facing major technical difficulties in source location, construction, or maintenance; (ii) logistical and organizational assistance; and (iii) monitoring and supervision of new projects.

actuality.verbatim: THESE TECHNICAL INPUTS ARE NEEDED TO FIRM UP IN UDAAS CAPABILITY TO EXTEND ITS SUPPORT TO RURAL AND PROVINCIAL WATER SUPPLY PROGRAMMES BEYOND ITS PRESENT LIMITED COVERAGE.
actuality.normalized: These technical inputs are needed to consolidate UDAAS’s capability to extend support to rural and provincial water-supply programmes beyond its current limited coverage.

entity.primary_reference: Project E: Provision of chemicals for water treatment (urban & suburban)
entity.description: Procurement of chlorine chemicals for urban and suburban water treatment.

actuality.verbatim: (E) PROVISION CHEMICALS FOR WATER TREATMENT IN URBAN AND SUBURBAN AREAS TOTAL : US DLRS 575,000
actuality.normalized: The total for provision of chemicals for water treatment in urban and suburban areas is US$575,000.

participants.subject_reference: Project E: Provision of chemicals for water treatment (urban & suburban)

actuality.verbatim: RENEWED AND SYSTEMATIC TREATMENT WATER SUPPLY URGENTLY REQUIRED IN COUNTRY'S MAIN URBAN AND SUBURBAN CENTRES WHERE CROWDING DUE INFLUX DISPLACED PERSONS ACCELERATING OVERALL DETERIORATION LIVING CONDITIONS WITH SIGNIFICANT INCREASE WATER-BORNE DISEASE AFFECTING PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE GROUPS.
actuality.normalized: Renewed and systematic treatment of water supply is urgently required in the country’s main urban and suburban centres, where crowding due to the influx of displaced persons is accelerating deterioration of living conditions and significantly increasing water-borne diseases, especially among vulnerable groups.

actuality.verbatim: TOTAL 170 TONS HYDROCHLORINE CALCIUM (US DLRS 275,000) AND 230 TONS GAS CHLORINE (US DLRS 300,000) REQUIRED.
actuality.normalized: A total of 170 tons of calcium hypochlorite (US$275,000) and 230 tons of chlorine gas (US$300,000) are required.

participants.subject_reference: Project E: Provision of chemicals for water treatment (urban & suburban)

actuality.verbatim: G R A N D T O T A L U S D L R S 5,675,000
actuality.normalized: Grand total: US$5,675,000.

entity.primary_reference: Part VI: Relief and survival items
entity.description: Section detailing emergency relief and survival items for affected and displaced populations.

actuality.verbatim: HIGH PERCENTAGE DISPLACED AND RURAL/URBAN AFFECTED POPULATION HAS LOST MOST POSSESSIONS, HAS NO ACCESS NECESSARY CONSUMER GOODS AND FACES STRINGENT SHORTAGES BASIC COMMODITIES.
actuality.normalized: A high percentage of displaced and affected rural/urban populations have lost most possessions, lack access to necessary consumer goods, and face severe shortages of basic commodities.

entity.description: Agency designated to distribute relief and survival items.

actuality.verbatim: BASED ON 2,522,600 AFFECTED AND 1,006,600 DISPLACED FOLLOWING RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS TO BE DISTRIBUTED BY DPCCN URGENTLY NEEDED.
actuality.normalized: Based on 2,522,600 affected and 1,006,600 displaced people, the following relief and survival items to be distributed by DPCCN are urgently needed.

entity.primary_reference: Relief item: Clothing and utility shoes
entity.description: Emergency clothing sets and utility shoes requested as donations in kind.

actuality.verbatim: (A) CLOTHING : 2,300,000 SETS - DONATIONS IN KIND REQUESTED UTILITY SHOES : 1,200,000 PAIRS - DONATIONS IN KIND REQUESTED
actuality.normalized: Clothing: 2,300,000 sets (donations in kind requested). Utility shoes: 1,200,000 pairs (donations in kind requested).

actuality.verbatim: TODAY NEED FOR CLOTHING IN MOZAMBIQUE AS SERIOUS AS NEED FOR FOOD.
actuality.normalized: The need for clothing in Mozambique today is as serious as the need for food.

actuality.verbatim: PROBLEM NUDITY INCREASINGLY GRAVE, WITH LARGE-SCALE IMPACT ON SOCIO-ECONOMIC SYSTEM: WOMEN, MEN WITHOUT CLOTHES DO NOT GO TO FIELDS TO WORK, DO NOT VISIT HEALTH CENTRES, CHILDREN WITHOUT CLOTHES DO NOT GO TO SCHOOL, ARE NOT TAKEN FOR VACCINATION OR MEDICAL TREATMENT.
actuality.normalized: Increasing nudity poses a grave problem with large-scale socio-economic impacts: adults without clothes avoid fields and health centres; unclothed children avoid school and are not brought for vaccination or treatment.

actuality.verbatim: MOST URGENT APPEAL THEREFORE BEING MADE FOR DONATIONS UTILITY CLOTHING AND SHOES.
actuality.normalized: An urgent appeal is being made for donations of utility clothing and shoes.

actuality.verbatim: PROVISION OPTIMAL REQUIREMENTS TWO CHANGES CLOTHING AND ONE PAIR SHOES PER AFFECTED AND DISPLACED PERSONS PER YEAR UNREALISTIC.
actuality.normalized: Providing the optimal requirement—two changes of clothing and one pair of shoes per affected/displaced person per year—is unrealistic.

actuality.verbatim: HOWEVER, PROVISION 2,300,000 SETS CLOTHING AND 1,200,000 PAIR SHOES REPRESENTING 30 PERCENT OVERALL NEEDS URGENTLY REQUIRED.
actuality.normalized: However, providing 2,300,000 clothing sets and 1,200,000 pairs of shoes—representing 30 percent of overall needs—is urgently required.

actuality.verbatim: EXAMPLE FOR WOMEN, SIMPLE STURDY COTTON FROCKS AND BLOUSES, PLAIN COLOURS, DIFFERENT SIZES, FOR MEN STURDY COTTON SHIRTS, AND LONG PANTS, IN DIFFERENT SIZES, FOR CHILDREN, T-SHIRTS AND SHORTS OF STURDY COTTON AND VARIOUS SIZES. ALL SHOES SHOULD BE FOR UTILITY WEAR ONLY, INCLUDING RUBBER-SOLED SNEAKERS FOR CHILDREN.
actuality.normalized: Examples: for women—simple, sturdy cotton frocks and blouses (plain colours, various sizes); for men—sturdy cotton shirts and long pants (various sizes); for children—sturdy cotton T-shirts and shorts (various sizes). All shoes should be for utility wear, including rubber-soled sneakers for children.

actuality.verbatim: EXPERIMENTS ALSO BEING MADE WITH FAMILY PACKAGES CONTAINING FABRIC, THREAD, BUTTONS AND NEEDLES FOR ALL MEMBERS FAMILY. WHENEVER POSSIBLE, THIS RESPONSE PREFERRED.
actuality.normalized: Experiments are being made with family packages containing fabric, thread, buttons, and needles for all family members; this response is preferred whenever possible.

entity.description: Emergency blankets requested.

actuality.verbatim: (B) BLANKETS : 1,058,760 US DLRS 2,250,000
actuality.normalized: Blankets: 1,058,760 units, costing US$2,250,000.

actuality.verbatim: IN FOUR MONTHS, COLD SEASON MOZAMBIQUE WILL BEGIN, WITH PEOPLE FACING EXPOSURE AND INCREASED HEALTH PROBLEMS WITHOUT MINIMAL COVER.
actuality.normalized: In four months Mozambique’s cold season will begin, and people without minimal cover will face exposure and increased health problems.

actuality.verbatim: TOTAL NEED ESTIMATED AT 3.5 MILLION BLANKETS, AT COST APPROXIMATELY 07 MILLION DOLLARS. THIS APPEAL REQUEST URGENT DONATION ONLY THIRTY PERCENT REAL NEED.
actuality.normalized: Total blanket need is estimated at 3.5 million units at an approximate cost of US$7 million; the appeal requests urgent donation of only 30 percent of the real need.

entity.description: Utility soap for personal hygiene and laundry.

actuality.verbatim: (C) UTILITY SOAP : 6,350 MTS US DLRS 3,500,000
actuality.normalized: Utility soap: 6,350 metric tons, costing US$3,500,000.

actuality.verbatim: SOAP FOR BOTH PERSONAL HYGIENE AND LAUNDRY EXTREMELY SCARCE THROUGHOUT COUNTRY DUE IN PART LACK FOREIGN CURRENCY INPUTS REQUIRED FOR RE-ACTIVATING LOCAL SOAP-MAKING CAPABILITIES.
actuality.normalized: Soap for personal hygiene and laundry is extremely scarce nationwide, partly due to lacking foreign currency inputs needed to reactivate local soap-making capacity.

actuality.verbatim: TOTAL NEED FOR DISPLACED AND AFFECTED POPULATION, BASED ON REQUIREMENT 06 KILOS PER PERSON PER YEAR ESTIMATED AT 21,163 MTS, AT COST US DLRS 11.6 MILLION, OF WHICH AT LEAST THIRTY PERCENT MOST URGENTLY NEEDED.
actuality.normalized: Total soap need for displaced and affected populations—based on 6 kilos per person per year—is estimated at 21,163 metric tons at a cost of US$11.6 million, of which at least 30 percent is most urgently needed.

actuality.verbatim: DONORS ALSO REQUESTED EXPLORE POSSIBILITIES ASSIST REHABILITATION LOCAL SOAP FACTORY FOR MORE LONG-TERM SOLUTION TO PROBLEM HYGIENE AND HEALTH.
actuality.normalized: Donors are requested to explore assisting rehabilitation of a local soap factory as a longer-term solution to hygiene and health problems.

entity.description: Sets of basic cooking utensils for displaced families.

actuality.verbatim: (D) COOKING UTENSILS : 201,230 SETS US DLRS 604,000
actuality.normalized: Cooking utensils: 201,230 sets, costing US$604,000.

actuality.verbatim: DISPLACED POPULATION OFTEN FORCED ABANDON ALL FAMILY POSSESSIONS.
actuality.normalized: Displaced populations are often forced to abandon all family possessions.

actuality.verbatim: SET OF THREE BASIC COOKING UTENSILS NEEDED FOR EACH OF APPROXIMATELY 200,000 FAMILIES AMONG DISPLACED.
actuality.normalized: A set of three basic cooking utensils is needed for each of approximately 200,000 displaced families.

actuality.verbatim: GRAND TOTAL ALL RELIEF ITEMS: US DLRS 6,354,000
actuality.normalized: Grand total for all relief items: US$6,354,000.

entity.description: Section outlining agricultural handtools, seeds, and related inputs for recovery.

actuality.verbatim: CRITICAL AND WIDESPREAD SHORTAGES BASIC AGRICULTURAL HANDTOOLS, SEEDS AND OTHER AGRI-INPUTS THROUGHOUT COUNTRY BEING HANDLED BY GOM WITHIN FRAMEWORK ITS STRATEGY FOR REHABILITATION AGRICULTURAL SECTOR.
actuality.normalized: Critical and widespread shortages of agricultural handtools, seeds, and other inputs nationwide are being handled by the Government of Mozambique within its agricultural-sector rehabilitation strategy framework.

actuality.verbatim: PROBLEM PARTICULARLY ACUTE AMONG DISPLACED FAMILIES, WHICH CURRENTLY REQUIRE HANDTOOLS, SEEDS IN ORDER RESTORE BASIC CAPACITY FOR SUBSISTANCE FARMING.
actuality.normalized: The problem is particularly acute among displaced families, who require handtools and seeds to restore basic subsistence-farming capacity.

actuality.verbatim: SMALL CENTRALIZED STORAGE FACILITIES FOR SAME ALSO REQUIRED IN KEY CLUSTER RESETTLEMENT AREAS.
actuality.normalized: Small centralized storage facilities for these inputs are also required in key cluster resettlement areas.

entity.description: Province in Mozambique.
Province in southern Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: FOLLOWING REQUEST BASED ON ESTIMATED 250,000 DISPLACED AND SEVERELY AFFECTED FAMILIES IN SOFALA (45 PERCENT), NIASSA (18 PERCENT), ZAMBEZIA (12 PERCENT), TETE (11 PERCENT), MANICA (7 PERCENT), INHAMBANE (4 PERCENT) AND MAPUTO (3 PERCENT).
actuality.normalized: The following request is based on an estimated 250,000 displaced and severely affected families distributed as: Sofala 45%, Niassa 18%, Zambezia 12%, Tete 11%, Manica 7%, Inhambane 4%, and Maputo 3%.

actuality.verbatim: HANDTOOLS SHOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AFTER AGREEMENT WITH GOM ON TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS.
actuality.normalized: Handtools should be made available as soon as possible after agreeing technical specifications with the Government of Mozambique.

entity.description: Section heading for seed requirements and C.I.F. costs.

actuality.verbatim: MAPUTO/BEIRA MAIZE 3,000 US DLRS 1,340,000 SORGHUM 375 126,000 GROUNDNUTS 1,500 1,500,000 COWPEAS 500 200,000 HORTICULTURE 1 100,000 5,376 3,266,000

entity.description: Mozambique Ministry of Agriculture.

actuality.verbatim: SOURCE VEGETABLE SEEDS NOT SIGNIFICANT PROVIDED SPECIFICATIONS CHECKED WITH MINAGRI.

entity.description: Capital city of Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: THESE SEEDS SHOULD START TO BECOME AVAILABLE MOZAMBIQUE FOR DISTRIBUTION BY NOVEMBER 1987.
actuality.normalized: These seeds should start to become available in Mozambique for distribution by November 1987.

entity.description: Neighboring country identified as a regional seed source.

actuality.normalized: Other seeds should be procured within the region—preferably in Zimbabwe, Zambia, and Malawi—and become available for distribution in Mozambique by July 1987.

actuality.normalized: Distribution factor (initial): For ~7,000 tons of goods, US$700,000 is required, calculated at US$0.50/ton/km with an average travel distance of 200 km.

entity.description: Conclusions and donor communication instructions.

actuality.verbatim: CONTENTS ABOVE APPEAL FOCUSES PRIMARILY ON EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE REQUIREMENT OF 3.5 MILLION SEVERELY AFFECTED AND DISPLACED MOZAMBICAN PEOPLE.
actuality.normalized: The appeal focuses primarily on emergency assistance for 3.5 million severely affected and displaced Mozambicans.

actuality.verbatim: HOWEVER, GOM INTENDS, DEPENDING AVAILABILITY RESOURCES, EXECUTING AGENTS, AND ACCESSIBILITY, TO BROADEN ABOVE APPROACH INTO MULTISECTORAL REHABILITATION PROGRAMMES TARGETTING SPECIFIC CLUSTERS OF DISPLACED PERSONS AND PROVIDING THEM WITH INTEGRATED SUPPORT INCLUDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
actuality.normalized: Subject to resources, implementing agents, and access, the Government of Mozambique intends to broaden the approach into multisectoral rehabilitation programmes targeting specific clusters of displaced persons with integrated support, including technical assistance.

entity.description: UN body responsible for disaster relief coordination and pledge tracking.
Referenced UN office in New York.
UN Resident Coordinator office in Maputo.
Under-Secretary-General, United Nations Disaster Relief Co-ordinator.

actuality.verbatim: TO ENSURE ACCURATE RECORDING OF PLEDGES VERSUS UNMET NEEDS, EXTREMELY IMPORTANT ALL REPEAT ALL DONORS KEEP UNDRO DIRECTLY INFORMED THEIR CURRENT AND PLANNED CONTRIBUTIONS AND PROGRAMMES.
actuality.normalized: All donors must keep UNDRO directly informed of current and planned contributions and programmes to ensure accurate recording of pledges versus unmet needs.

actuality.verbatim: THIS INFORMATION TO BE SENT UNDRO (TELEX 28148 UNDR CH) WITH COPY RESIDENT CO-ORDINATOR/MAPUTO (TELEX 6364 UNDEV) AND FARAH/ LAMUNIERE, UN/OSPQ, N.Y. (TELEX UNATIONS 82731 OR 62450).
actuality.normalized: Information should be sent to UNDRO (Telex 28148 UNDR CH), with copies to the Resident Coordinator/Maputo (Telex 6364 UNDEV) and Farah/Lamuniere, UN/OSPQ, New York (Telex UNATIONS 82731 or 62450).

entity.primary_reference: Corrigendum to Sitrep No. 1 (87/0440) of 27 February 1987
entity.description: Corrigendum reflecting changes to Part VII (Essential agricultural inputs) and Part VIII (Summary all requirements).

actuality.normalized: Corrigendum—handtools (Maputo/Beira, C.I.F.): Hoes 675,000 (US$1,675,000); Machetes 250,000 (US$750,000); Axes 250,000 (US$1,875,000); Sickles 75,000 (US$150,000); Files 250,000 (US$750,000). Total: US$5,200,000.

actuality.verbatim: HANDTOOLS SHOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AFTER AGREEMENT WITH GOM ON TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS.
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum reiteration: make handtools available as soon as possible after agreement with GOM on technical specifications.

actuality.verbatim: MAPUTO/BEIRA MAIZE 3,000 US DLRS 1,340,000 SORGHUM 375 126,000 GROUNDNUTS 1,500 1,500,000 COWPEAS 500 200,000 HORTICULTURE 10 100,000 5,385 3,266,000
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum—seeds (Maputo/Beira, C.I.F.): Maize 3,000 t (US$1,340,000); Sorghum 375 t (US$126,000); Groundnuts 1,500 t (US$1,500,000); Cowpeas 500 t (US$200,000); Horticulture seeds 10 t (US$100,000). Total: 5,385 t, US$3,266,000.

actuality.verbatim: SOURCE VEGETABLE SEEDS NOT SIGNIFICANT PROVIDED SPECIFICATIONS CHECKED WITH MINAGRI.
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum reiteration: source of vegetable seeds is not significant if specifications are verified with MINAGRI.

actuality.verbatim: THESE SEEDS SHOULD START TO BECOME AVAILABLE MOZAMBIQUE FOR DISTRIBUTION BY NOVEMBER 1987. OTHER SEEDS SHOULD BE BOUGHT WITHIN REGION, PREFERABLY IN ZIMBABWE, ZAMBIA, AND MALAWI AND SHOULD START TO BECOME AVAILABLE FOR DISTRIBUTION IN MOZAMBIQUE BY JULY 1987.
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum maintains availability timelines: Maputo/Beira seeds by November 1987; regional seeds (Zimbabwe, Zambia, Malawi) by July 1987.

actuality.verbatim: FOR VOLUME OF ABOUT 7,000 TONS GOODS, AN ESTIMATED US DLRS 735,000 WILL BE REQUIRED, CALCULATED ON BASIS US DLRS 0.35 PER TON PER KM, AVERAGE TRAVEL DISTANCE 300 KMS.
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum—distribution factor: For ~7,000 tons, US$735,000 required at US$0.35/ton/km with average distance 300 km.

entity.description: Tarpaulins for temporary protection of handtools and seeds.

actuality.verbatim: IT WILL BE NECESSARY TO PROVIDE ABOUT 150 20 X 20 M TARPAULINS FOR TEMPORARY PROTECTION IN SOME LOCALITIES. THE COST INVOLVED WOULD BE ABOUT US DLRS 35,000.
actuality.normalized: Corrigendum—temporary storage: Provide about 150 tarpaulins (20×20 m) for temporary protection in some localities; cost about US$35,000.

entity.description: Pesticides to counter migratory pests, particularly in drought-affected areas.

actuality.verbatim: GIVEN THE HIGH RISK OF MIGRATORY PESTS, IN PARTICULAR IN AREAS WHICH HAVE BEEN AFFECTED BY DROUGHT IN PREVIOUS YEARS IT IS IMPORTANT TO MAKE AVAILABLE AN ALLOCATION OF US DLRS 100,000 FOR THE PURCHASE OF PESTICIDES.
actuality.normalized: Due to the high risk of migratory pests—especially in areas previously affected by drought—an allocation of US$100,000 should be made available to purchase pesticides.

actuality.verbatim: G R A N D T O T A L : U S D L R S 9,336,000 (US DLRS 37/DISPLACED FAMILY)
actuality.normalized: Grand total for essential agricultural inputs (updated): US$9,336,000 (US$37 per displaced family).

actuality.verbatim: CEREALS (INDICATIVE) US DLRS 169,000,000 OTHER FOOD 41,938,000 SUB-TOTAL 210,938,000
actuality.normalized: Food aid (unchanged): Cereals (indicative) US$169,000,000; Other food US$41,938,000; Subtotal US$210,938,000.

actuality.verbatim: NON FOOD AID: LOGISTICS SUPPORT US DLRS 6,347,000 HEALTH 8,305,000 WATER 5,675,000 RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS 6,354,000 AGRICULTURAL IN-PUTS 9,336,000 SUB-TOTAL 36,017,000
actuality.normalized: Non-food aid (updated): Logistics support US$6,347,000; Health US$8,305,000; Water US$5,675,000; Relief & survival items US$6,354,000; Agricultural inputs US$9,336,000; Subtotal US$36,017,000.

actuality.verbatim: G R A N D T O T A L U S D L R S 246,955,000
actuality.normalized: Grand total (all requirements, updated): US$246,955,000.

entity.primary_reference: UNDRO 87/0546 – Mozambique Civil Strife/Drought, Sitrep No. 2
entity.description: UNDRO Situation Report No. 2 dated 13 March 1987.

actuality.verbatim: ON 27 FEBRUARY 1987 A SPECIAL EMERGENCY APPEAL OF THE SECRETARY GENERAL OF THE UNITED NATIONS WAS LAUNCHED CALLING FOR HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE TO VICTIMS OF CIVIL STRIFE AND DROUGHT IN MOZAMBIQUE.
actuality.normalized: On 27 February 1987, the UN Secretary-General launched a special emergency appeal for humanitarian assistance to victims of civil strife and drought in Mozambique.

entity.description: Donors’ meeting called for 31 March 1987 regarding Mozambique emergency assistance.

alias_list: H.E. Mr Mario da Graça Machungo
entity.description: Prime Minister of Mozambique; head of GOM delegation to donors’ meeting.

actuality.verbatim: A DONORS MEETING HAS NOW BEEN CALLED FOR 31 MARCH. THE DELEGATION OF THE GOVERNMENT OF MOZAMBIQUE AT THIS MEETING WILL BE HEADED BY THE PRIME MINISTER, HIS EXCELLENCY MR MARIO DA GRACA MACHUNGO.
actuality.normalized: A donors’ meeting has been called for 31 March 1987; the Government of Mozambique’s delegation will be headed by Prime Minister H.E. Mario da Graça Machungo.

actuality.verbatim: PURPOSE OF UNDRO SITREP NO. 2 IS TO PROVIDE AN UPDATE OF RECENT EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES CARRIED OUT IN MOZAMBIQUE BY UN AGENCIES AND MAJOR NGOS.
actuality.normalized: The purpose of UNDRO Sitrep No. 2 is to update recent emergency-assistance activities carried out in Mozambique by UN agencies and major NGOs.

actuality.verbatim: THIS SUMMARY IS BASED ON RECENT INFORMATION PROVIDED TO UNDRO BY ORGANIZATIONS CONCERNED.
actuality.normalized: The summary is based on recent information provided to UNDRO by the organizations concerned.

actuality.verbatim: UNDRO ENVISAGES ISSUING AS FROM APRIL 1987 AND UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE, MONTHLY SITUATION REPORTS ON: - NUMBER OF AFFECTED AND DISPLACED PERSONS, - DONORS' RESPONSE TO SG'S APPEAL OF 27 FEBRUARY 1987 AND UNMET REQUIREMENTS, - PROGRAMMES AND PLANS OF UN AGENCIES AND NGOS RELATING TO SG'S APPEAL.
actuality.normalized: Starting April 1987 and until further notice, UNDRO plans to issue monthly situation reports covering: numbers of affected and displaced; donors’ response to the 27 February 1987 appeal and unmet requirements; and UN agency/NGO programmes and plans related to the appeal.

actuality.verbatim: THESE REPORTS WILL BE COMPILED FROM INPUTS RECEIVED FROM THE UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR FOR EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATIONS IN MOZAMBIQUE, WHICH ARE BASED ON EXTENSIVE AND REGULAR CONSULTATIONS BETWEEN HIM, GOVERNMENT, UN AGENCIES, DONORS AND NGOS THROUGH APPROPRIATE COORDINATING MECHANISMS AT FIELD LEVEL, AS WELL AS FROM CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED FROM HEADQUARTERS OF THE ORGANIZATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS CONCERNED.
actuality.normalized: Reports will be compiled from inputs by the UN Special Coordinator for Emergency Relief Operations in Mozambique—based on extensive, regular consultations with government, UN agencies, donors, and NGOs via field-level mechanisms—and from contributions from the organizations’ headquarters.
