entity.primary_reference: UN Special Coordinator for Emergency Relief Operations in Mozambique
entity.description: Role coordinating UN emergency relief operations in Mozambique and serving as UNDRO representative.
2,000 tons of aluminium sulphate for water purification delivered to Beira and Maputo.
Origin point for shipments of cooking utensils, blankets, and handtools funded by Italy.
Donor funding NGO health programmes in Inhambane and Sofala.
Donor funding shipments of relief items from Pisa warehouse.

actuality.verbatim: WITH FUNDS DONATED BY CANADIAN GOVERNMENT, UNDRO IS (I) CONTINUING TO SUPPORT GOVERNMENTAL DEPARTMENT FOR PREVENTION, CONTROL AND COMBAT NATURAL DISASTERS (DPCCN) AND ITS LOGISTICS BASE IN PROVINCE ZAMBEZIA, THROUGH PROVISION OF TRUCKS AND VEHICLES AS WELL AS COMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT AND TOOLS, (II) FOR WATER PURIFICATION, PROVIDING TWO THOUSAND TONS OF ALUMINIUM SULPHATE WHICH ARE BEING DELIVERED TO BEIRA AND MAPUTO.
actuality.normalized: With Canadian funds, UNDRO continues to support DPCCN and its Zambezia logistics base via trucks, vehicles, communications equipment, and tools; and is providing 2,000 tons of aluminium sulphate for water purification delivered to Beira and Maputo.

actuality.verbatim: WITH AUSTRALIAN CONTRIBUTION, UNDRO IS FINANCING HEALTH PROGRAMMES OF NGOS - MEDECINS DU MONDE/HOPITAL SANS FRONTIERES, COMMUNITY AID ABROAD - IN PROVINCES INHAMBANE AND SOFALA.
actuality.normalized: With Australian funding, UNDRO is financing NGO health programmes (Médecins du Monde/Hôpital Sans Frontières and Community Aid Abroad) in Inhambane and Sofala provinces.

actuality.verbatim: WITH ITALIAN FUNDS, COOKING UTENSILS, BLANKETS AND HANDTOOLS WERE SHIPPED FROM THE PISA WAREHOUSE.
actuality.normalized: With Italian funds, cooking utensils, blankets, and handtools were shipped from the Pisa warehouse.

actuality.verbatim: TO ASSIST THE UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR IN HIS CAPACITY AS UNDRO REPRESENTATIVE, UNDRO WILL, SUBJECT TO RECEIPT OF CASH CONTRIBUTIONS, POST TWO DELEGATES TO MAPUTO. TOTAL COST OF THESE POSTINGS AMOUNTS TO US DLRS 170,000.
actuality.normalized: Subject to receiving cash contributions, UNDRO will post two delegates to Maputo to assist the UN Special Coordinator; the total cost is US$170,000.

actuality.verbatim: SUPPORT PROVIDED TO DPCCN IN LOGISTICAL SECTOR (EMERGENCY AIRLIFT AND ROAD FLEET MAINTENANCE) AND IN AREA OF PLANNING AND INFORMATION.
actuality.normalized: Support to DPCCN includes logistics (emergency airlift and road-fleet maintenance) and planning and information.

actuality.verbatim: IN COOPERATION WITH MINISTRY OF HEALTH, HEALTH AND NUTRITION PROGRAMMES ARE BEING CARRIED OUT (ESSENTIAL DRUGS AND IMMUNIZATION). AT PROVINCIAL LEVEL RELIEF ITEMS SUCH AS SEEDS, SUPPLEMENTARY FOODS AND HOUSEHOLD ITEMS ARE PROVIDED. RURAL WATER SUPPLIES PROJECTS CARRIED OUT, ESPECIALLY IN PROVINCES INHAMBANE AND CABO DELGADO.
actuality.normalized: In cooperation with the Ministry of Health, UNICEF is implementing health and nutrition programmes (essential drugs and immunization), providing seeds, supplementary foods, and household items at provincial level, and carrying out rural water-supply projects, especially in Inhambane and Cabo Delgado.

entity.description: Government ministry cooperating with UNICEF on health and nutrition programmes.
Province where rural water-supply projects are carried out.
Region most severely affected by civil strife; site of UN assessment mission.

actuality.verbatim: WITH GOVERNMENTAL AND WFP PARTICIPATION, UNITED NATIONS SPECIAL COORDINATOR FOR EMERGENCY RELIEF OPERATIONS IN MOZAMBIQUE CONDUCTED FROM 27 TO 28 FEB UN ASSESSMENT MISSION EMERGENCY/FOOD SITUATION IN ZAMBEZIA, WHICH IS REGION MOST SEVERELY AFFECTED BY CIVIL STRIFE.
actuality.normalized: With government and WFP participation, the UN Special Coordinator conducted a UN assessment mission on 27–28 February on the emergency/food situation in Zambezia, the region most severely affected by civil strife.

actuality.verbatim: MISSION REVIEWED FOOD AID LOGISTICS, HEALTH CARE, AND ACCESS TO BENEFICIARIES, EXAMINED NEEDS FOR DISPLACED PERSONS IN RECEPTION CENTRES AND IDENTIFIED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE REQUIREMENTS FOR DPCCN PROVINCIAL OFFICE.
actuality.normalized: The mission reviewed food-aid logistics, health care, and beneficiary access; examined displaced persons’ needs in reception centres; and identified technical-assistance requirements for the DPCCN provincial office.

actuality.verbatim: EARLY MARCH 1987 UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR CONVENED SERIES OF MEETINGS WITH GOVERNMENT, BILATERAL DONORS, UN AGENCIES AND NGOS TO REVIEW EMERGENCY OPERATIONS AND PRESENT SECRETARY GENERAL'S APPEAL.
actuality.normalized: In early March 1987, the UN Special Coordinator convened meetings with the government, bilateral donors, UN agencies, and NGOs to review emergency operations and present the Secretary-General’s appeal.

actuality.verbatim: PARTICULAR EMPHASIS WAS PLACED ON (I) COORDINATION BOTH BY UN SYSTEM AND BY MOZGOVT CONCERNING INFORMATION, NEEDS AND DONATIONS BUT ALSO RE ARRIVAL/DISTRIBUTION EMERGENCY SUPPLIES, (II) DONOR FLEXIBILITY IN ORDER AVOID REDUNDANCY OR OVERLAP IN SUPPLY SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS, AND (III) EXTENT TO WHICH EMERGENCY IN MOZAMBIQUE LINKED WITH REGIONAL PROBLEMS.
actuality.normalized: Emphasis areas: (i) coordination by the UN system and the Mozambican Government on information, needs, donations, and arrival/distribution of emergency supplies; (ii) donor flexibility to avoid redundancy/overlap in supplying specific requirements; and (iii) the extent to which the emergency is linked to regional problems.

actuality.verbatim: SECOND ROUND OF MEETINGS SCHEDULED PRIOR MEETING OF 31 MARCH.
actuality.normalized: A second round of meetings is scheduled prior to the 31 March donors’ meeting.

actuality.verbatim: UNDP IS STRENGTHENING ITS OFFICE IN MAPUTO SUBSTANTIALLY TO PROMOTE ENHANCED COOPERATION AND RESPONSE OF THE UN SYSTEM TO THE SITUATION AT HAND AND TO ALLOW THE SPECIAL COORDINATOR TO CONCENTRATE HIS ACTIVITIES ON EMERGENCY-RELATED MATTERS.
actuality.normalized: UNDP is substantially strengthening its Maputo office to promote enhanced UN-system cooperation and response and to allow the Special Coordinator to focus on emergency-related matters.

entity.description: UN programme providing skilled volunteers to support emergency operations.

actuality.verbatim: SERVICES OF MECHANICS, DATA-BASE MANAGERS AND SANITARY ENGINEERS HAVE BEEN PROVIDED.
actuality.normalized: UNV has provided mechanics, database managers, and sanitary engineers.

actuality.verbatim: AT PRESENT SANITARY ENGINEERS ARE ATTACHED TO WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION SCHEMES IN PROVINCES CABO DELGADO AND MANICA AND CITY TETE.
actuality.normalized: Sanitary engineers are attached to water-supply and sanitation schemes in Cabo Delgado, Manica, and Tete City.

actuality.verbatim: UNV IS MAKING INPUT TO UNICEF LOGISTICS AND NUTRITIONAL SUPPORT PROJECTS.
actuality.normalized: UNV is contributing to UNICEF logistics and nutritional-support projects.

alias_list: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
entity.description: UN refugee agency supporting displaced Mozambicans and returnees.

actuality.verbatim: APPEAL LAUNCHED TO COVER NEEDS OF DISPLACED MOZAMBICANS IN MALAWI AND RETURNEES.
actuality.normalized: UNHCR has launched an appeal to cover the needs of displaced Mozambicans in Malawi and returning populations.

actuality.verbatim: UNHCR FIELD CAPACITY IN THE PROVINCE OF TETE, TO WHICH DISPLACED PERSONS IN MALAWI ARE EXPECTED TO RETURN, IS BEING STRENGTHENED.
actuality.normalized: UNHCR is strengthening its field capacity in Tete Province in anticipation of returns from Malawi.

entity.description: UN food-aid agency operating emergency food pipelines and logistics.

actuality.verbatim: UNDER ONGOING EMERGENCY OPERATION, 12,000 TONS OF MAIZE, 3,535 TONS OF BEANS AND 50 TONS OF LYOPHILIZED PRODUCTS WERE SUPPLIED FOR DISTRIBUTION TO 1,473,000 DROUGHT VICTIMS AND DISPLACED PERSONS LOCATED IN PROVINCES INHAMBANE, GAZA, SOFALA, MANICA, TETE AND ZAMBEZIA.
actuality.normalized: WFP supplied 12,000 t maize, 3,535 t beans, and 50 t lyophilized products for 1,473,000 drought victims and displaced persons in Inhambane, Gaza, Sofala, Manica, Tete, and Zambezia.

actuality.verbatim: DISTRIBUTION IS EXPECTED TO BE COMPLETED IN APRIL 1987 (THOUGH CURRENT STOCKS OF BILATERAL FOOD COMMODITIES MAY LAST UNTIL MID-1987).
actuality.normalized: Distribution is expected to finish in April 1987, though bilateral food stocks may last until mid-1987.

actuality.verbatim: AS CONTINUATION OF ITS ASSISTANCE BEYOND APRIL 1987, WFP APPROVED ON 18 FEB 87, ADDITIONAL SUPPLY OF 11,000 TONS OF MAIZE, 2,000 TONS OF BEANS AND 50 TONS OF LYOPHILIZED PRODUCTS AT TOTAL COST OF US DLRS 4.7 MILLION.
actuality.normalized: On 18 Feb 1987, WFP approved an additional 11,000 t maize, 2,000 t beans, and 50 t lyophilized products at a total cost of US$4.7 million for assistance beyond April 1987.

actuality.verbatim: FOOD AID UNDER THIS FORTHCOMING EMERGENCY OPERATION WILL COVER UNMET FOOD AID REQUIREMENTS OF APPROXIMATELY 760,000 PERSONS IN PROVINCES INHAMBANE, GAZA, MANICA, SOFALA AND TETE.
actuality.normalized: The forthcoming WFP operation will cover unmet food-aid needs of ~760,000 people in Inhambane, Gaza, Manica, Sofala, and Tete.

actuality.verbatim: LOGISTICS COORDINATOR HAS BEEN POSTED IN MAPUTO TO HELP ORGANIZE AND DIRECT FLOW OF EMERGENCY FOOD AID. FOOD AID COORDINATOR BEING ASSIGNED TO FOOD MANAGEMENT UNIT, MINISTRY INTERNAL TRADE. SENIOR OFFICER EXPERIENCED EMERGENCY OPERATIONS MANAGEMENT BEING ASSIGNED WFP OFFICE MAPUTO.
actuality.normalized: WFP posted a logistics coordinator in Maputo, assigned a food-aid coordinator to the Food Management Unit (Ministry of Internal Trade), and is assigning a senior emergency-operations officer to the WFP Maputo office.

actuality.verbatim: HIGH LEVEL FOOD AID AND LOGISTICS MISSION CURRENTLY IN MOZAMBIQUE REVIEWING OVERALL SITUATION AND WILL REVERT.
actuality.normalized: A high-level food-aid and logistics mission is in Mozambique reviewing the overall situation.

actuality.verbatim: LOGISTICAL FOOD DELIVERY OPERATION BEING CARRIED OUT BY SEA TO COASTAL AREAS IN INHAMBANE BY THE VESSEL 'CINQ JUIN'. RECENTLY THIS VESSEL WAS JOINED BY ANOTHER BOAT CHARTERED BY WFP, THE 'IDUN'. WFP PLANS TO CONTINUE THIS LOGISTICAL OPERATION BY SEA.
actuality.normalized: Sea delivery to coastal Inhambane is being carried out by the vessel 'Cinq Juin', now joined by WFP-chartered 'Idun'; WFP plans to continue sea operations.

actuality.verbatim: THE 'CINQ JUIN' HAS MADE OVER 110 TRIPS THUS FAR CARRYING 335 TONS OF FOOD ON EACH FOR A TOTAL OF 335,000 TONS.
actuality.normalized: Initial report: 'Cinq Juin' made over 110 trips carrying 335 tons each; total stated as 335,000 tons (corrigendum issued later).

entity.description: UN agency supporting agricultural emergency and rehabilitation.

actuality.verbatim: PROSPECTS FOR CEREAL CROPS TO BE HARVESTED APRIL 1987 UNFAVOURABLE.
actuality.normalized: FAO reports unfavourable prospects for April 1987 cereal harvests.

actuality.verbatim: MISSION TO MOZAMBIQUE BEING CARRIED OUT TO ASSIST GOVT IN PREPARATION OF PROJECT PROPOSALS AND PLAN OF ACTION FOR EMERGENCY AND REHABILITATION IN AGRICULTURAL SECTOR.
actuality.normalized: An FAO mission is assisting the government to prepare project proposals and a plan of action for agricultural emergency and rehabilitation.

entity.description: UN health agency collaborating on needs evaluation and primary care rehabilitation.

actuality.verbatim: TOGETHER WITH UNICEF, WHO FORMS PART OF WORKING GROUP IN MINISTRY OF HEALTH EVALUATING HEALTH NEEDS (DRUGS, MEDICAL SUPPLIES, CONSTRUCTION MATERIAL, WATER SUPPLY SCHEMES AND EQUIPMENT FOR REHABILITATION OF PRIMARY LEVEL HEALTH FACILITIES).
actuality.normalized: WHO, with UNICEF, is part of an MoH working group evaluating needs for drugs, medical supplies, construction materials, water-supply schemes, and equipment to rehabilitate primary-level health facilities.

actuality.verbatim: FAMILY HEALTH KITS ARE FORESEEN FOR HOUSEHOLDS AND INSTALLATIONS RECEIVING ORPHANS.
actuality.normalized: Family health kits are planned for households and institutions receiving orphans.

entity.description: International NGO providing logistics support and agricultural inputs.

actuality.verbatim: CARE DISASTER LOGISTICS UNIT (LSU) ASSISTS DPCCN TO COORDINATE AND TO MANAGE VARIOUS ASPECTS OF EMERGENCY FOOD AID. ADVISORY TEAM OF 17 TECHNICAL AND LOGISTICAL MANAGERS PLACED TO TRAIN DPCCN STAFF AND TO FACILITATE RECEIPT, STORAGE AND DISTRIBUTION OF EMERGENCY FOOD.
actuality.normalized: CARE’s Disaster Logistics Unit assists DPCCN coordination and management of emergency food aid; 17 technical/logistics managers train DPCCN staff and facilitate receipt, storage, and distribution.

actuality.verbatim: SEEDS AND HANDTOOLS PROVIDED TO LOCAL FARMERS.
actuality.normalized: CARE is providing seeds and handtools to local farmers.

entity.primary_reference: League of Red Cross Societies / Mozambican Red Cross emergency unit
entity.description: Joint emergency unit with LRCS, Ministry of Health, and DPCCN.

actuality.verbatim: MOZAMBICAN RED CROSS CREATED EMERGENCY UNIT WITH REPRESENTATIVES LRCS, MINHEALTH AND DPCCN.
actuality.normalized: The Mozambican Red Cross created an emergency unit with LRCS, the Ministry of Health, and DPCCN representatives.

actuality.verbatim: FOLLOWING PRIORITY PROVINCES IDENTIFIED: NIASSA, TETE, ZAMBEZIA AND MANICA.
actuality.normalized: Priority provinces: Niassa, Tete, Zambezia, and Manica.

actuality.verbatim: IN ZAMBEZIA PROVINCE APPROXIMATELY 35,000 DISPLACED PERSONS IN CHINDE AND 4,000 IN INHASSUNGE ARE BEING ASSISTED BY MOZAMBICAN RED CROSS (MRCS) WITH SUPPORT OF LRCS DELEGATION. MRCS HAS TWO TEAMS TOTALLING 20 FIRST-AIDERS WORKING ON THE SPOT (ONE IN EACH DISTRICT).
actuality.normalized: MRCS, supported by LRCS, assists ~35,000 displaced in Chinde and ~4,000 in Inhassunge (Zambezia) with two teams totaling 20 first-aiders (one per district).

actuality.verbatim: A JOINT LRCS/ICRC MISSION IS SCHEDULED FOR APRIL 1987 TO DETERMINE DIVISION OF RESPONSIBILITIES BETWEEN THE TWO AGENCIES.
actuality.normalized: A joint LRCS/ICRC mission is scheduled for April 1987 to determine division of responsibilities.

entity.description: Faith-based NGO launching emergency appeal and conducting fact-finding.

actuality.verbatim: ON 2 MARCH LWF LAUNCHED AN EMERGENCY APPEAL. FACT-FINDING MISSION AT PRESENT DETERMINING USE OF DONORS' RESPONSE.
actuality.normalized: LWF launched an emergency appeal on 2 March 1987 and is conducting a fact-finding mission to determine use of donor response.

entity.description: Medical NGO rehabilitating health facilities and providing supplies.

actuality.verbatim: REHABILITATION OF HEALTH FACILITIES IN NORTHERN INHAMBANE. MEDICAL TEAMS SENT TO INHAMBANE AND HAS SUPPLIED MEDICAMENTS AND BASIC MEDICAL EQUIPMENT TO INHAMBANE AND SOFALA PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: MSF (Belgium) is rehabilitating health facilities in northern Inhambane, has deployed medical teams to Inhambane, and supplied medicines and basic equipment to Inhambane and Sofala.

entity.description: Medical NGO rehabilitating Mocuba Hospital and operating airlift/ophthalmology services.

actuality.verbatim: REHABILITATION WORKS OF MOCUBA HOSPITAL (ZAMBEZIA) DUE FOR COMPLETION IN JUNE 1987. MSF TEAM SHALL STAY ON UNTIL 1988.
actuality.normalized: MSF (France) plans to complete Mocuba Hospital rehabilitation by June 1987; the team will remain until 1988.

actuality.verbatim: AN AIRLIFT (MEDICAMENTS, VACCINES, MATERIALS, MEDICAL EVACUATIONS) COVERS ISOLATED TOWNS IN MANICA AND TETE PROVINCES. OPHTALMOLOGIST CARE PROVIDED TO TETE HOSPITAL AND PROVINCIAL DISPENSARIES ACCESSIBLE BY ROAD.
actuality.normalized: An MSF (France) airlift provides medicines, vaccines, materials, and medevacs to isolated towns in Manica and Tete; ophthalmology care is provided to Tete Hospital and accessible provincial dispensaries.

entity.primary_reference: Oxfam (UK) / Save the Children (UK) joint appeal
entity.description: Joint relief and recovery programme focus and phasing.

actuality.verbatim: APPEAL LAUNCHED ON 12 FEB 1987. RELIEF PROGRAMMES WILL CONCENTRATE ON GAZA, NIASSA, TETE, ZAMBEZIA PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: Oxfam (UK) and Save the Children (UK) launched an appeal on 12 Feb 1987, concentrating efforts in Gaza, Niassa, Tete, and Zambezia.

actuality.verbatim: FIRST PHASE WILL INCLUDE RELIEF ITEMS SUCH AS GRAIN, HIGH ENERGY BISCUITS, MEDICINES, BLANKETS, FABRIC, SEWING KITS, COOKING POTS. SECOND PHASE WILL CONSIST OF PROVISION OF SEEDS, FERTILIZERS AND TOOLS FOR 50,000 FAMILIES MAINLY IN ZAMBEZIA PROVINCE IN ORDER THAT THEY MAY PLANT DURING PERIOD OCT 87 - FEB 88.
actuality.normalized: Phase 1: relief items (grain, high-energy biscuits, medicines, blankets, fabric, sewing kits, cooking pots). Phase 2: seeds, fertilizers, and tools for 50,000 families—mainly in Zambezia—to plant Oct 1987–Feb 1988.

entity.description: Child-focused NGO implementing health project in Gaza Province.

actuality.verbatim: CHILD SURVIVAL/PRIMARY HEALTH CARE PROJECT UNDERTAKEN IN PROVINCE OF GAZA COVERING A POPULATION OF 15,000.
actuality.normalized: Save the Children (USA) is undertaking a child-survival/primary health care project in Gaza Province covering 15,000 people.

entity.primary_reference: World Council of Churches (WCC) – 1987 emergency appeal
entity.description: Six-month appeal for relief items to be distributed via Christian Council of Mozambique and DPCCN.

actuality.verbatim: A 1987 SIX-MONTH EMERGENCY APPEAL LAUNCHED FOR FOOD, SEEDS, TOOLS, MEDICINES, BLANKETS, HOUSEHOLD UTENSILS TO BE DISTRIBUTED BY CHRISTIAN COUNCIL OF MOZAMBIQUE IN COOPERATION WITH DPCCN IN PROVINCES OF GAZA, INHAMBANE, MAPUTO, SOFALA AND TETE.
actuality.normalized: WCC launched a six-month 1987 emergency appeal for multiple relief items to be distributed by the Christian Council of Mozambique with DPCCN in Gaza, Inhambane, Maputo, Sofala, and Tete.

entity.description: Christian NGO providing large-scale food aid and agri-inputs.

actuality.verbatim: FROM 1 OCTOBER 1986 TO 30 SEPTEMBER 1987, 24,500 MT MAIZE, 3,000 MT BEANS AND 3,000 MT VEGETABLE OIL BEING PROVIDED TO PROVINCES OF GAZA, MANICA, MAPUTO, TETE AND ZAMBEZIA, THROUGH DPCCN, MOZAMBICAN RED CROSS, CARITAS AND CHRISTIAN COUNCIL OF MOZAMBIQUE.
actuality.normalized: From 1 Oct 1986 to 30 Sep 1987, WVI is providing 24,500 MT maize, 3,000 MT beans, and 3,000 MT vegetable oil to Gaza, Manica, Maputo, Tete, and Zambezia through DPCCN, Moz Red Cross, Caritas, and the Christian Council of Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: DISTRIBUTION PACKAGES OF AGRICULTURAL INPUTS (SEED, HANDTOOLS AND MANUALS) TO 10,000 FARMERS IN TETE AND 8,000 FARMERS IN ZAMBEZIA.
actuality.normalized: WVI is distributing agricultural input packages (seed, handtools, manuals) to 10,000 farmers in Tete and 8,000 in Zambezia.

entity.description: Instructions to donors for reporting contributions vs unmet needs.

actuality.verbatim: TO ENSURE ACCURATE RECORDING OF CONTRIBUTIONS VERSUS UNMET NEEDS, IMPORTANT ALL DONORS KEEP UNDRO DIRECTLY INFORMED THEIR CURRENT AND PLANNED CONTRIBUTIONS AND PROGRAMMES.
actuality.normalized: All donors should keep UNDRO directly informed of current and planned contributions and programmes to ensure accurate recording versus unmet needs.

actuality.verbatim: THIS INFORMATION TO BE SENT UNDRO (28148 UNDR CH) WITH COPY RESIDENT COORDINATOR/MAPUTO (TELEX 6364 UNDEV) AND FARAH/LAMUNIERE, UN/OSPQ, N.Y. (TELEX UNATIONS 82731 OR 62450).
actuality.normalized: Send to UNDRO (28148 UNDR CH), with copies to Resident Coordinator/Maputo (Telex 6364 UNDEV) and Farah/Lamuniere, UN/OSPQ, New York (Telex UNATIONS 82731 or 62450).

entity.primary_reference: Corrigendum to Sitrep No. 2 (UNDRO 87/0546B) of 13 March 1987
entity.description: Corrigendum correcting WFP para 18 sea-delivery statistics.

actuality.verbatim: PART TWO WFP PARA 18 SECOND SENTENCE SHOULD READ AS FOLLOWS: THE 'CINQ JUIN' HAS MADE SAME 125 TRIPS THUS FAR CARRYING APROXIMATELY 45,000 TONS OF EMERGENCY FOOD.
actuality.normalized: Correction: 'Cinq Juin' has made approximately 125 trips carrying ~45,000 tons of emergency food (superseding earlier figures).

entity.primary_reference: UNDRO 87/0708 – Mozambique Destabilization/Drought Sitrep No. 3 (3 April 1987)
entity.description: UNDRO situation report covering the 31 March donor meeting outcomes and coordination measures.

actuality.verbatim: THE INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITY ... PARTICIPATED IN THE MEETING CHAIRED BY THE UNITED NATIONS DISASTER RELIEF CO-ORDINATOR.
actuality.normalized: On 31 March 1987, a UN-chaired humanitarian assistance meeting for Mozambique was held with the Mozambican Government (led by the Prime Minister), the UN Special Coordinator, representatives of 53 governments, 2 intergovernmental organizations, 14 UN agencies, and 37 NGOs.

actuality.verbatim: THE UNDER-SECRETARY-GENERAL ... STRESSING THE NEED FOR IMMEDIATE ACTION ...
actuality.normalized: A message from the UN Secretary-General, transmitted by the USG for Special Political Questions, stressed the need for immediate action to prevent further intensification of the emergency.

actuality.verbatim: THE PRIME MINISTER GAVE AN OVERVIEW ... RESULT OF EXTERNALLY INDUCED DESTABILISATION. HE OUTLINED MEASURES ... TO ENHANCE NATIONAL AID CO-ORDINATION AND RECEPTION CAPACITY.
actuality.normalized: Mozambique’s Prime Minister outlined the crisis as driven by externally induced destabilization and presented measures to enhance national aid coordination and reception capacity.

actuality.verbatim: THE UN SPECIAL CO-ORDINATOR ... STRESSED THE NEED FOR A CENTRAL INFORMATION SYSTEM FOR COLLECTION/ANALYSIS/DISSEMINATION OF EMERGENCY DATA.
actuality.normalized: The UN Special Coordinator emphasized establishing a central information system for collecting, analyzing, and disseminating emergency data.

actuality.verbatim: A CLEAR COMMITMENT ... WAS EXPRESSED BY DONOR GOVERNMENTS AND REPRESENTATIVES OF NGOS AND UN SYSTEM. REPRESENTATIVES OF AFRICAN COUNTRIES ... EMPHASIZED THEIR SOLIDARITY ...
actuality.normalized: Donor governments, NGOs, and UN entities expressed commitment to alleviate the crisis; African country representatives emphasized solidarity with Mozambique.

actuality.verbatim: THE MEETING ... DISCUSSED QUESTIONS RELATED TO LOGISTICS, RELIEF MANAGEMENT IN GENERAL AND ACCESSIBILITY OF AFFECTED POPULATION.
actuality.normalized: The meeting discussed logistics, overall relief management, and access to affected populations.

actuality.verbatim: ON 1 APRIL 1987, A FOLLOW-UP MEETING WAS HELD WITH NGOS (35) AND UN AGENCIES ...
actuality.normalized: On 1 April 1987, a follow-up coordination meeting with 35 NGOs and UN agencies was held with the Mozambican Minister of Cooperation and the UN Special Coordinator.

actuality.verbatim: EQUAL PARTNERSHIP ... WAS ADVOCATED. ... A RECOMMENDATION WAS MADE FOR NGOS TO IMPROVE THEIR OWN COORDINATION MECHANISMS AT NATIONAL, PROVINCIAL AND SECTORAL LEVEL.
actuality.normalized: Equal partnership in relief management between governmental and non-governmental organizations was advocated; NGOs were recommended to improve coordination mechanisms at national, provincial, and sectoral levels to avoid duplication and enable unified reporting.

actuality.verbatim: COMMITMENTS ... AMOUNTED TO APPROX. US DOLLARS 209 MILLION. ... TENTATIVE LIST OF PLEDGED CONTRIBUTIONS ... TOTAL 209,101,000.
actuality.normalized: Preliminary 1987 relief commitments totaled approximately US$209,101,000, with a tentative by-country list provided (e.g., USA $75.464m; Italy $38.5m; EEC $27.88m; UK $12.789m; Canada $12.367m; Sweden $11m; Netherlands $11m; etc.).

actuality.verbatim: UNDRO IS AT PRESENT VERIFYING THESE DATA AND MATCHING THEM AGAINST RELIEF REQUIREMENTS. ... A FINAL LIST ... WILL BE ISSUED SHORTLY.
actuality.normalized: UNDRO is verifying pledged data and matching against requirements; a finalized list will be issued.

actuality.verbatim: TO ENSURE ACCURATE RECORDING OF CONTRIBUTIONS ... ALL DONORS KEEP UNDRO INFORMED ... THIS INFORMATION TO BE SENT UNDRO (28148 UNDR CH) ...
actuality.normalized: Donors are requested to keep UNDRO informed of current and planned contributions and programmes; send to UNDRO (28148 UNDR CH) with copies to the Resident Coordinator/Maputo and UN/OSPQ, New York (Telex UNATIONS 82731 or 62450).

entity.primary_reference: UNDRO 87/1041 – Mozambique Destabilization/Drought Sitrep No. 4 (15 May 1987)
entity.description: UNDRO situation report updating impacts, needs, coordination and funding requirements.

actuality.verbatim: PROVINCES REPORTED MOST AFFECTED BY WAR ARE TETE, ZAMBEZIA AND SOFALA.
actuality.normalized: Most war-affected provinces: Tete, Zambezia, and Sofala; liberated but road-inaccessible areas urgently need food.

actuality.verbatim: WFP HAS ALMOST COMPLETED AIRLIFT OF 100 MT FOOD AND RELIEF SUPPLIES FROM BEIRA TO INHAMINGA, SOFALA PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: WFP is near completion of a 100 MT airlift of food and relief supplies from Beira to Inhaminga, Sofala.

actuality.verbatim: FAO MISSION ... CONFIRMED THAT OUTLOOK FOR CEREAL CROPS ... IS UNFAVOURABLE. ... AREA PLANTED WAS SERIOUSLY REDUCED ... SOUTHERN PROVINCES ... SEVERELY AFFECTED BY DROUGHT. ... PRODUCTION OF CEREALS WILL PROBABLY BE LESS THAN THE POOR 1986 CROP ... NON-CEREAL STAPLES ALSO LIKELY TO DECLINE.
actuality.normalized: FAO confirms unfavourable harvest outlook: reduced planted area nationwide; severe drought impacts in Gaza, Inhambane, and Maputo; cereal output likely below 1986’s poor crop, with declines in non-cereal staples as well.

actuality.verbatim: MOST RECENT ESTIMATE ... TOTAL 4.3 MILLION. ... TABLE OF DISPLACED/AFFECTED BY PROVINCE. ... IN ADDITION 306,000 PEOPLE FROM TETE ... DISPLACED IN OTHER COUNTRIES ...
actuality.normalized: Mozambican authorities estimate 4,305,609 affected and displaced people nationwide (by-province breakdown provided), with an additional 306,000 people from Tete displaced in Malawi, Zambia, and Zimbabwe.

actuality.verbatim: REQUIREMENTS IN SECTORS WATER AND AGRICULTURAL INPUTS ... ARE STILL LARGELY UNMET ... GOVT EMPHASIZES IMPORTANCE ... TO ACHIEVE SELF-SUFFICIENCY.
actuality.normalized: Needs in water and agricultural inputs remain largely unmet; the Government prioritizes contributions to these sectors to support self-sufficiency.

actuality.verbatim: UNDRO ... HAS FIELDED (1) ADVISER/EMERGENCY LIAISON OFFICER ... (2) INFORMATION SYSTEM EXPERT (SECONDED BY UNHCR) ... (3) COORDINATION ADVISERS AT PROVINCIAL LEVEL (SO FAR TWO ADVISERS SENT TO ... SOFALA AND ZAMBEZIA). THIS ... MADE POSSIBLE BY UK GOVT'S ... FUNDING OF FIELD DELEGATES.
actuality.normalized: UNDRO deployed an emergency liaison adviser, an information-system expert (seconded by UNHCR), and provincial coordination advisers (two posted to Sofala and Zambezia), funded by the UK Government.

entity.description: National executive commission, UN Emergency Operations Group with four standing committees, and provincial commissions with UNDRO and WFP staff.

actuality.verbatim: UN/GOVT DONORS/NGOS ... UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR ... UN EMERGENCY OPERATIONS GROUP WITH FOUR TECHNICAL STANDING COMMITTEES: - FOOD/LOGISTICS/DISTRIBUTION - HEALTH/NUTRITION/RELIEF - AGRICULTURE/WATER - RETURNEES/DISPLACED ... PROVINCIAL LEVEL ... FOUR COORDINATION ADVISERS ... FOUR WFP FOOD LOGISTICS STAFF ...
actuality.normalized: Coordination architecture includes a UN Special Coordinator working with Government/Donors/NGOs; a UN Emergency Operations Group with standing committees (Food/Logistics/Distribution; Health/Nutrition/Relief; Agriculture/Water; Returnees/Displaced); and provincial commissions supported by UNDRO coordination advisers and WFP logistics staff (assignments underway in Sofala and Zambezia).

actuality.verbatim: FOOD REQUIREMENTS ... PROVISIONAL: A. CEREALS (MT) AID REQUIREMENTS 674,000 PLEDGES/CONTRIBUTIONS 457,000 SHORTFALL 217,000. B. OTHER FOOD SHORTFALL (MT) SUGAR 40,000 OIL 2,000 PULSES 47,000.
actuality.normalized: Provisional May 1987–April 1988: cereals need 674,000 MT (457,000 pledged; 217,000 shortfall). Other shortfalls: sugar 40,000 MT; oil 2,000 MT; pulses 47,000 MT.

actuality.verbatim: NON-FOOD (TOTAL VALUE UNMET NEEDS: US DLRS 27,166,000) A. LOGISTICS SUPPORT: US DLRS 2,617,000 ... B. HEALTH: US DLRS 4,671,000 ... C. WATER: US DLRS 5,675,000 ... D. RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS: US DLRS 5,780,000 ... E. AGRICULTURAL INPUTS: US DLRS 8,423,000 ...
actuality.normalized: Unmet non-food needs total US$27,166,000: Logistics $2.617m; Health $4.671m; Water $5.675m; Relief/Survival items $5.780m; Agricultural inputs $8.423m (with detailed subcomponents listed).

actuality.verbatim: UNICEF: INTEGRATED RESETTLEMENT PROJECT IN MANICA DISTRICT REQUIRES AN ADDITIONAL US DLRS 270,000.
actuality.normalized: UNICEF requests an additional US$270,000 for the Integrated Resettlement Project in Manica District.

actuality.verbatim: WFP: APPEALING FOR CONTRIBUTIONS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE STORAGE/OFFTAKE CAPACITY AT MAPUTO PORT AND DELIVERY/STORAGE/OFFTAKE CAPACITY (INCLUDING AIRLIFTS) AT CENTRAL AND PROVINCIAL DELIVERY POINTS.
actuality.normalized: WFP appeals for contributions to improve storage/offtake at Maputo Port and to strengthen delivery, storage, and offtake capacity—including airlifts—at central and provincial points.

actuality.verbatim: CARE INTERNATIONAL: USD 430,000 FOR SUPPLY OF BASIC CONSUMER GOODS AND LOGISTICS SUPPORT TO DISPLACED AND AFFECTED IN INTERIOR INHAMBANE PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: CARE International requests US$430,000 for basic goods and logistics support to displaced and affected populations in interior Inhambane.

actuality.verbatim: CARITAS INTERNATIONALIS: USD 2,798,000 TO CARRY OUT A COMPREHENSIVE 1987 RELIEF PROGRAMME FOR 40,000-50,000 FAMILIES. SO FAR USD 1,600,000 HAVE BEEN RECEIVED/PLEDGED.
actuality.normalized: Caritas Internationalis requests US$2,798,000 for a 1987 relief programme targeting 40,000–50,000 families; US$1.6 million received/pledged to date.

actuality.verbatim: EDUARDO MONDLANE FOUNDATION/NETHERLANDS: USD 995,250 FOR EMERGENCY RELIEF AND INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT IN ALTO CHANGANE, GAZA.
actuality.normalized: Eduardo Mondlane Foundation (Netherlands) requests US$995,250 for emergency relief and integrated rural development in Alto Changane, Gaza.

actuality.verbatim: OPERATION HANDICAP INTERNATIONAL/FRANCE: USD 339,120 FOR TRAINING OF STAFF AT INHAMBANE HOSPITAL.
actuality.normalized: Operation Handicap International (France) requests US$339,120 for staff training at Inhambane Hospital.

actuality.verbatim: OXFAM/UK: USD 1,747,715 FOR INTEGRATED RELIEF PROGRAMME IN MAUA AND CUAMBA, NIASSA.
actuality.normalized: Oxfam UK requests US$1,747,715 for integrated relief in Maua and Cuamba, Niassa Province.

actuality.verbatim: SAVE CHILDREN FUND/UK: USD 1,300,000 FOR SEA TRANSPORT ENHANCEMENT AND TRAINING FOR ZAMBEZIA.
actuality.normalized: Save the Children Fund (UK) requests US$1,300,000 to enhance sea transport and provide training in Zambezia.

actuality.verbatim: GOVERNMENTAL AND INTER-GOVERNMENTAL PLEDGES/CONTRIBUTIONS: TOTAL US DLRS 180,167,000.
actuality.normalized: Governmental and inter-governmental pledges/contributions for 1987 total US$180,167,000 (countries listed include Australia, Austria, Belgium, Botswana, Brazil, Canada, Czechoslovakia, Denmark, Finland, France, GDR, FRG, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Kenya, Netherlands, New Zealand, Nigeria, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Sweden, USSR, UK, USA, Yugoslavia, and EEC).

actuality.verbatim: THE UN SYSTEM (UNICEF, WFP, WHO) CONTRIBUTED US DLRS 10,284,000.
actuality.normalized: UN system contributions (UNICEF, WFP, WHO) amount to US$10,284,000 in 1987.

actuality.verbatim: PLEDGES/CONTRIBUTIONS FROM NGOS/PRIVATE SECTORS AMOUNT TO US DLRS 7,845,000.
actuality.normalized: NGO/private-sector pledges and contributions total US$7,845,000 (including ADRA, CARE, Caritas, Food for the Hungry, Help the Aged, Hôpital Sans Frontières, LRCS, LWF, Médecins du Monde, Médecins Sans Frontières, Oxfam, Redd Barna, Save the Children, World Vision).

actuality.verbatim: TOTAL CONTRIBUTIONS WHOSE VALUE HAS BEEN REPORTED TO UNDRO APPROX US DLRS 200 MILLION.
actuality.normalized: Approximately US$200 million in contributions have been reported to UNDRO for 1987.

actuality.verbatim: DONORS ARE REQUESTED TO INFORM UNDRO DIRECTLY, PREFERABLY BY TELEX (28148 UNDR CH), OF THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS AND VALUE.
actuality.normalized: Donors are requested to inform UNDRO directly (preferably via telex 28148 UNDR CH) of their contributions and values.

entity.primary_reference: UNDRO 87/1118 – Mozambique Destabilization/Drought Sitrep No. 5 (22 May 1987)
entity.description: UNDRO situation report updating airlift operations and unmet non-food requirements, with funding channels and NGO project status.

actuality.verbatim: WFP AIRLIFT OF RELIEF SUPPLIES FROM BEIRA TO INHAMINGA IS BEING CONTINUED. AIR TRANSPORT 200 MT WILL BE FINANCED BY UNDRO WITH CANADIAN CONTRIBUTION.
actuality.normalized: WFP continues the Beira→Inhaminga relief airlift; UNDRO will finance air transport of 200 MT using a Canadian contribution.

actuality.verbatim: REQUIREMENTS (US DLRS) / CONTRIBUTIONS (US DLRS) / UNMET REQUIREMENTS (US DLRS) ...
actuality.normalized: Updated non-food figures (US$): Logistics support 6,347,000 required / 3,730,000 contributed / 2,617,000 unmet; Health 8,305,000 / 3,634,000 / 4,671,000 unmet; Water 5,675,000 / 0 / 5,675,000 unmet; Relief & survival items 6,354,000 / 574,000 / 5,780,000 unmet; Agricultural inputs 9,336,000 / 913,000 / 8,423,000 unmet. Totals: 36,017,000 required / 8,851,000 contributed / 27,166,000 unmet.

actuality.verbatim: PROPOSED PRINCIPAL CHANNELS ... LOGISTICS SUPPORT: ... UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR/UNDRO, UNICEF, WFP ... HEALTH: UNICEF, WHO ... WATER: UNICEF ... RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS: UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR/UNDRO, UNICEF ... AGRICULTURAL INPUTS: UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR/UNDRO, FAO.
actuality.normalized: Designated channels for unmet non-food funding: Logistics (UNSC/UNDRO, UNICEF, WFP); Health (UNICEF, WHO); Water (UNICEF); Relief & survival items (UNSC/UNDRO, UNICEF); Agricultural inputs (UNSC/UNDRO, FAO).

actuality.verbatim: EDUARDO MONDLANE FOUNDATION/NETHERLANDS: EMERGENCY RELIEF AND INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT IN ALTO CHANGANE, GAZA. (FUNDED BY GOVT NETHERLANDS)
actuality.normalized: Eduardo Mondlane Foundation project (Alto Changane, Gaza) fully financed by the Government of the Netherlands.

actuality.verbatim: OXFAM/UK, REDD BARNA/NORWAY: INTEGRATED RELIEF PROGRAMME IN MAUA AND CUAMBA, NIASSA. (FUNDED BY OXFAM/UK AND REDD BARNA/NORWAY)
actuality.normalized: Oxfam (UK) and Redd Barna (Norway) integrated relief programme in Maua and Cuamba, Niassa is fully financed by the implementing NGOs.

actuality.verbatim: CARITAS INTERNATIONALIS ... INITIAL REQUIREMENT: US DLRS 2,798,000 CONTRIBUTION: US DLRS 1,600,000 UNMET NEED: US DLRS 1,198,000
actuality.normalized: Caritas Internationalis 1987 relief programme: US$2,798,000 required; US$1,600,000 contributed; US$1,198,000 unmet.

actuality.verbatim: OPERATION HANDICAP INTERNATIONAL/FRANCE ... INITIAL REQUIREMENT: US DLRS 339,120 CONTRIBUTION: US DLRS 134,870 (EEC CONTRIBUTION ECUS 117,000) UNMET NEED: US DLRS 204,250
actuality.normalized: Operation Handicap International (France) training at Inhambane Provincial Hospitals: US$339,120 required; US$134,870 contributed (including ECUs 117,000 from EEC); US$204,250 unmet.

actuality.verbatim: CARE INTERNATIONAL: SUPPLY OF BASIC CONSUMER GOODS AND LOGISTICS SUPPORT ... REQUIREMENT: US DLRS 430,000
actuality.normalized: CARE International project for basic goods and logistics support in interior Inhambane remains unfunded (US$430,000 required).

actuality.verbatim: SAVE CHILDREN FUND/UK: SEA TRANSPORT ENHANCEMENT AND TRAINING FOR ZAMBEZIA. REQUIREMENT: US DLRS 1,300,000
actuality.normalized: Save the Children Fund (UK) sea transport enhancement and training for Zambezia remains unfunded (US$1,300,000 required).

actuality.verbatim: DONORS ARE REQUESTED TO INFORM UNDRO DIRECTLY, PREFERABLY BY TELEX (28148 UNDR CH), OF THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS AND VALUE.
actuality.normalized: Repeat request: donors should inform UNDRO directly (telex 28148 UNDR CH) of contributions and values.

entity.primary_reference: UNDRO 87/1396 – Mozambique Destabilization/Drought Sitrep No. 6 (23 June 1987)
entity.description: UNDRO situation report on coordination mechanisms, logistics, unmet requirements, and agency/NGO activities.
Government-led committee (~20 participants from Government, donor governments, NGOs, and UN) meeting weekly, chaired by the Vice-Minister of Trade; UNDRO adviser serves as secretary.

actuality.verbatim: GOVT HAS SET UP SPECIAL EMERGENCY OPERATIONS COMMITTEE ... WEEKLY MEETINGS CHAIRED BY VICE-MINISTER OF TRADE. UNDRO ADVISER ... ACTS AS SECRETARY OF THE COMMITTEE.
actuality.normalized: Mozambique established a Special Emergency Operations Committee holding weekly meetings chaired by the Vice-Minister of Trade; an UNDRO adviser acts as committee secretary.

actuality.verbatim: COMPUTER EQUIPMENT (DONATED BY SWISS GOVT) ... HAS BEEN INSTALLED. UNDRO DELEGATES ARE ADAPTING SOFTWARE ... LOCAL STAFF BEING TRAINED ...
actuality.normalized: Computer equipment donated by Switzerland installed at the UN Special Coordinator’s office (UNSCERO) to manage requirements/contributions data; UNDRO delegates are adapting software and training local staff.

actuality.verbatim: IMPORT/CLEARANCE PROCEDURES AND UNLOADING SERVICES BEING REVIEWED TO ALLOW FOR EXPEDITIOUS AND SIMPLIFIED HANDLING OF EMERGENCY DONATIONS.
actuality.normalized: Import/clearance procedures and unloading services are under review to expedite and simplify handling of emergency donations.

actuality.verbatim: FUTURE SCHEDULING OF FOOD AID SHIPMENTS SHOULD BE CHECKED WITH WFP MOZAMBIQUE EMERGENCY TASK FORCE/ROME CHAIRMAN ELLIS ...
actuality.normalized: Recommendation: coordinate future food-aid shipment scheduling with WFP Mozambique Emergency Task Force (Rome) to avoid bottlenecks.

actuality.verbatim: RELIEF REQUIREMENTS LARGELY UNMET IN AREAS WATER, RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS AND AGRICULTURAL INPUTS ... DUTCH CONTRIBUTION OF US DLRS 961,000 ... REDUCING NEEDS IN THIS SECTOR TO US DLRS 3,710,000.
actuality.normalized: Unmet needs persist in water, relief/survival items, and agricultural inputs; a Dutch US$961,000 contribution via UNICEF to emergency health reduces health-sector unmet needs to US$3,710,000.

actuality.verbatim: WFP REPORTS WHEAT AND RICE REQUIREMENTS FOR CROP YEAR 87/88 COVERED WHEREAS NEED FOR MAIZE, PULSES AND VEGOIL NOT YET MET.
actuality.normalized: For crop year 1987/88, wheat and rice needs are covered; maize, pulses, and vegetable oil needs remain unmet.

actuality.verbatim: WFP APPEAL FOR CASH CONTRIBUTIONS ... HAS MET WITH RESPONSE FROM GOVTS NEW ZEALAND, SWEDEN, SWITZERLAND. ADDITIONAL EQUIPMENT ... STILL NEEDED.
actuality.normalized: WFP’s cash appeal for port delivery/storage/offtake equipment received responses from New Zealand, Sweden, and Switzerland; additional items still needed include 8 shunting tractors, 500 pallets, 5 tractors, ten 5-ton heavy-duty trailers, five 4-WD vehicles, and five roller stackers.

actuality.verbatim: ADDITIONAL FINANCING REQUIRED FOR (A) STRENGTHENING COASTAL TRANSPORT (WFP), (B) DPCCN - OPERATED AIRLIFT ... (C) WFP AIRLIFT IN SOFALA PROVINCE (FOLLOWING DELIVERY OF 400 MT EMERGENCY FOOD AID).
actuality.normalized: Additional financing requested to: strengthen coastal transport (WFP), fund DPCCN-operated airlifts across affected provinces, and continue the WFP airlift in Sofala following delivery of 400 MT of emergency food aid.

actuality.verbatim: FROM 18 TO 26 MAY, 1,800 PEOPLE ARRIVED FROM ZIMBABWE TO ESPUNGABERA RESETTLEMENT PROJECT SITE IN PROVINCE MANICA. SOME 1,500 NEW ARRIVALS EXPECTED IN NEXT THREE MONTHS.
actuality.normalized: Between 18–26 May, 1,800 arrivals from Zimbabwe reached the Espungabera resettlement site (Manica); ~1,500 additional arrivals expected over the next three months.

actuality.verbatim: REINTEGRATION OF MORE THAN 2,500 ORPHANS IN FAMILIES IS BEING CARRIED OUT IN EIGHT PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: Reintegration of over 2,500 orphans into families is underway across eight provinces.

actuality.verbatim: UNICEF-ASSISTED MARKETING CAMPAIGN (BASIC GOODS IN EXCHANGE FOR LOCALLY PRODUCED FOOD ITEMS) IN WESTERN NIASSA UNDERWAY.
actuality.normalized: A UNICEF-assisted marketing campaign is underway in western Niassa, exchanging basic goods for locally produced food items.

actuality.verbatim: FAO MISSION ... CONFIRMED REQUIREMENTS FOR AGRICULTURAL INPUTS (VALUE USD 9,336,000) AS INCLUDED IN SEC-GEN APPEAL.
actuality.normalized: FAO confirms agricultural input requirements valued at US$9,336,000 as per the Secretary-General’s appeal.

actuality.verbatim: FAO LAUNCHED APPEAL FOR SIX INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS (TOTAL VALUE USD 9,105,000) IN PROVINCES SOFALA AND ZAMBEZIA ...
actuality.normalized: FAO launched an appeal for six integrated rural development projects totaling US$9,105,000 in Sofala and Zambezia to benefit displaced farming families and the wider rural community.

actuality.verbatim: MEDICINES, MEDICAL EQUIPMENT AND CLOTHING HAVE BEEN SENT TO PROVINCES SOFALA (TRANSPORT FUNDED BY FRENCH GOVT). CFUM IS MADE UP OF 17 FRENCH NGOS.
actuality.normalized: The Collectif Français Urgence Mozambique (17 French NGOs) sent medicines, medical equipment, and clothing to Sofala; transport funded by the French Government.

actuality.verbatim: CLOTHING, SHOES AND CLOTH HAVE BEEN SHIPPED AND CASH GRANTS COLLECTED TO VALUE AUS.DLRS 250,000 (USD 176,056).
actuality.normalized: Community Aid Abroad (Australia) shipped clothing, shoes, and cloth, and collected AUS$250,000 (US$176,056) in cash grants.

actuality.verbatim: IN 1987 FOLLOWING FOOD ITEMS AND RELIEF SUPPLIES (TOTAL VALUE US DLRS 2,293,000) DELIVERED ... MANICA: 710 MT MAIZE; TETE: 150 MT PEANUTS AND 760 MT BEANS; SALT, COOKING AND AGRICULTURAL UTENSILS.
actuality.normalized: German Agro Action delivered in 1987 (total value US$2,293,000): Manica—710 MT maize; Tete—150 MT peanuts, 760 MT beans; plus salt and cooking/agricultural utensils.

actuality.verbatim: ICRC IS RESUMING RELIEF ACTIVITIES IN MOZ. SURVEY HAS BEEN CONDUCTED TO ASSESS NUTRITIONAL AND MEDICAL NEEDS OF CONFLICT VICTIMS.
actuality.normalized: ICRC is resuming relief operations in Mozambique and has conducted a survey to assess the nutritional and medical needs of conflict victims.

actuality.verbatim: IN CLOSE COOPERATION, WHEN POSSIBLE, WITH THE MOZAMBIQUE RED CROSS, OPERATIONS WILL BE CARRIED OUT IN PROVINCES NAMPULA, NIASSA, SOFALA, TETE AND ZAMBEZIA. OPERATIONAL CENTRE IN QUELIMANE AND LOGISTICS BASE IN BEIRA.
actuality.normalized: ICRC, in cooperation with the Mozambique Red Cross, plans operations in Nampula, Niassa, Sofala, Tete and Zambezia; operational centre in Quelimane; logistics base in Beira.

actuality.verbatim: FINANCIAL NEEDS FOR SECOND HALF 87: SFR 8 MILLION (USD 5,298,013).
actuality.normalized: ICRC requires SFr 8,000,000 (≈US$5,298,013) for the second half of 1987.

actuality.verbatim: MSF IS CARRYING OUT IN INHAMBANE PROVINCE THEIR MEDICAL/ NUTRITIONAL PROGRAMME INITIATED IN FEB 86.
actuality.normalized: Médecins Sans Frontières (Belgium) continues its medical and nutritional programme in Inhambane, initiated in February 1986.

actuality.verbatim: FINANCING OF FIRST HALF 1987 COVERED BY EEC AND GOVT BELGIUM.
actuality.normalized: MSF’s Inhambane programme financing for the first half of 1987 was covered by the EEC and the Government of Belgium.

actuality.verbatim: FOR CONTINUATION THIS PROGRAMME UNTIL MARCH 1988 AND EXTENSION TO OTHER PARTS OF SAME PROVINCE CONTRIBUTION OF ECU 1,935,000 (US DLRS 2,226,185) IS REQUIRED.
actuality.normalized: MSF (Belgium) requests ECU 1,935,000 (≈US$2,226,185) to continue until March 1988 and extend activities within Inhambane.

actuality.verbatim: AIRLIFT (CEREALS, BEANS, SALT, SEEDS, TOOLS, CLOTHING, SOAP) TO REMOTE PART NIASSA PROVINCE PLANNED TO START END JUNE 87 TO RUN FOR SIX MONTHS.
actuality.normalized: Oxfam (UK) and Redd Barna (Norway) plan a six-month airlift to remote areas of Niassa starting end-June 1987, transporting cereals, beans, salt, seeds, tools, clothing and soap.

actuality.verbatim: REPRESENTATIVES CHRISTIAN COUNCIL MOZAMBIQUE AND NEIGHBOURING NATIONAL CHRISTIAN COUNCILS AND SERVICE DIVISIONS TOGETHER WITH WCC AND LWF REPRESENTATIVES MET ON 11-12 JUNE IN GENEVA FOR CONSULTATION ON RELIEF ASSISTANCE IN MOZ AND NEIGHBOURING COUNTRIES.
actuality.normalized: On 11–12 June (Geneva), CCM, neighbouring councils, and WCC/LWF representatives consulted on relief assistance for Mozambique and neighbours.

actuality.verbatim: APPEAL LAUNCHED FOR CASH CONTRIBUTIONS US DLRS 4.5 MILLION TOWARDS RELIEF ASSISTANCE IN MOZAMBIQUE (FOOD, SOAP, CLOTHING, BLANKETS, HOUSEHOLD UTENSILS, SEEDS, TOOLS AND HEALTH CARE AND DOMESTIC WATER SUPPLY).
actuality.normalized: WCC launched a US$4.5 million cash appeal for relief in Mozambique covering food, NFIs, health care, and domestic water supply.

actuality.verbatim: 4,500 MT MAIZE DONATED BY AUSTRALIAN DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE BUREAU WILL BE DISTRIBUTED IN GAZA AND SOFALA PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: ADAB donated 4,500 MT of maize for World Vision to distribute in Gaza and Sofala provinces.

actuality.verbatim: TRAINING IN CONSTRUCTION AND WATER IS OFFERED TO WORKERS OF MOZAMBICAN CONSTRUCTION MINISTRY. STUDENTS IN MANICA PROVINCE TRAINED IN CONSTRUCTION AND SANITATION.
actuality.normalized: World Vision offers training in construction and water to Construction Ministry workers; students in Manica are being trained in construction and sanitation.

actuality.verbatim: CONTRIBUTIONS REPORTED TO UNDRO SINCE SITREP NO. 5 DATED 22 MAY 87 AMOUNT TO US DLRS 10,012,000 ...
actuality.normalized: Since Sitrep No. 5 (22 May 1987), reported contributions total US$10,012,000: governments US$8,525,000; Red Cross societies US$310,000; NGOs US$1,177,000 (named entities listed).

actuality.verbatim: DONORS ARE REQUESTED TO INFORM UNDRO DIRECTLY, PREFERABLY BY TELEX (28148 UNDR CH), WITH COPY UNSCERO/MAPUTO (TELEX 6364 UNDEV), OF THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS AND VALUE.
actuality.normalized: Donors should inform UNDRO directly via telex 28148 UNDR CH, copying UNSCERO/Maputo (telex 6364 UNDEV), with details and values of contributions.

actuality.verbatim: WITH CONTRIBUTION CANADIAN GOVERNMENT, UNDRO HAS RENTED CESSNA 402C AIRCRAFT FOR SIX MONTHS AND HAS PLACED IT AT DISPOSAL OF UNITED NATIONS SPECIAL COORDINATOR ... TO FACILITATE FIELD ASSESSMENT OF NEEDS AND COORDINATION OF AID. AIRCRAFT EXPECTED START OPERATIONS BY MID-AUGUST.
actuality.normalized: Using Canadian funding, UNDRO leased a Cessna 402C for six months for UNSCERO to support needs assessment and aid coordination; operations expected to start by mid-August 1987.

actuality.verbatim: UNDRO DELEGATE SECONDED BY SWISS DISASTER RELIEF CORPS HAS INSTALLED COMPUTER EQUIPMENT IN OFFICES OF RECENTLY CREATED EMERGENCY OPERATIONS COMMITTEE ... TO SYSTEMATIZE PLANNING AND MONITORING OF EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE.
actuality.normalized: Computer equipment installed in the Emergency Operations Committee offices to systematize planning and monitoring of emergency assistance.

actuality.verbatim: UNDRO SPECIAL ADVISOR AND EMERGENCY LIAISON OFFICER TO UNSCERO Y. LAGIER BEING REPLACED BY B. HAMMARSTROEM.
actuality.normalized: UNDRO replaces Special Advisor/Emergency Liaison Officer Y. Lagier with B. Hammarstroem.

actuality.verbatim: TWO ITALIAN SHIPMENTS OF RICE, VEGOIL, CLOTHING MATERIALS, SOAP, CRANES AND TRUCKS, VALUED US DLRS 6.3 MILLION, WERE DELIVERED IN JULY TO PORTS OF BEIRA, QUELIMANE.
actuality.normalized: Italy delivered in July shipments valued at US$6.3M (rice, vegetable oil, clothing materials, soap, cranes, trucks) to Beira and Quelimane.

actuality.verbatim: IN NIASSA PROVINCE OXFAM HAS STARTED AIRLIFT RELIEF SUPPLIES FROM CUAMBA TO MAUA, METARICA, NIPEPE AND MARRUPA.
actuality.normalized: Oxfam has begun airlifting relief supplies within Niassa from Cuamba to Maua, Metarica, Nipepe, and Marrupa.

actuality.verbatim: VESSEL CHARTERED BY BRITISH RED CROSS SOCIETY WITH SUPPORT UK GOVT WILL UNLOAD RELIEF GOODS ... TO PORTS OF MAPUTO, BEIRA, QUELIMANE, NACALA AND PEMBA DURING AUGUST 1987. BRCS PART OF CARGO CONSISTS OF DSM, FEEDING KITS, SUGAR, BLANKETS, ROLLS POLYTHENE SHEETING, TENTS, ANTIBIOTICS, ORAL REHYDRATION SALT, CLOTHING, COOKING POTS, SOAP, FORKLIFT TRUCKS, VEHICLES.
actuality.normalized: A BRCS-chartered vessel, supported by the UK Government, will unload Red Cross/ICRC relief goods at Maputo, Beira, Quelimane, Nacala, and Pemba in August 1987; cargo includes foods, NFIs, medical supplies, and handling/transport equipment.

actuality.verbatim: DELIVERY RATE CONTINUES TO BE LIMITED BY A) INACCESSIBILITY OF MANY AREAS BY LAND, B) NEED FOR CONVOYS ... C) DISRUPTION OF NATIONAL RAIL SYSTEM (ABOUT 50 PERCENT FUNCTIONING).
actuality.normalized: Deliveries constrained by land inaccessibility, convoy requirements for transport security, and a national rail system operating at ~50% capacity.

actuality.verbatim: DIFFICULTIES ALSO EXPERIENCED IN ROAD TRANSPORT BETWEEN MALAWI AND PROVINCE NIASSA THROUGH ENTRY POINT MANDIMBA.
actuality.normalized: Road transport difficulties reported at the Mandimba entry point between Malawi and Niassa Province.

actuality.verbatim: JOINT ASSESSMENT MISSION ... LEAVING ON 30 JULY 87 FOR NIASSA TO REPORT TO EMERGENCY OPERATIONS COMMITTEE ON 3 AUG 87.
actuality.normalized: A joint mission (Government, WFP, Dutch Government, Oxfam UK) departs 30 July 1987 to Niassa, reporting to the Emergency Operations Committee on 3 August 1987.

actuality.verbatim: EMERGENCY OPERATIONS COMMITTEE REVIEWED CRITERIA AND RESPONSIBILITIES FOR ASSESSMENT FOOD NEEDS AND FOOD DISTRIBUTION IN CONSULTATION WITH WFP.
actuality.normalized: The Emergency Operations Committee, in consultation with WFP, reviewed criteria and responsibilities for food needs assessment and distribution.

actuality.verbatim: PROPOSED PRINCIPAL CHANNEL ... REQUIREMENTS (US DLRS) CONTRIBUTIONS (US DLRS) UNMET REQUIREMENTS (US DLRS) ... TOTAL 42,189,000 14,632,000 27,557,000
actuality.normalized: Updated non-food needs (US$): Logistics 12,219,000 req / 7,317,000 contrib / 4,902,000 unmet; Health 8,605,000 / 5,003,000 / 3,602,000; Water 5,675,000 / 55,000 / 5,620,000; Relief & Survival 6,354,000 / 1,369,000 / 4,985,000; Agricultural inputs 9,336,000 / 888,000 / 8,448,000. Total: 42,189,000 required; 14,632,000 contributed; 27,557,000 unmet. Channels: Logistics (UNSCERO/UNDRO, UNICEF, WFP); Health (UNICEF, WHO); Water (UNICEF); Relief & Survival (UNSCERO/UNDRO, UNICEF); Agricultural inputs (UNSCERO/UNDRO, FAO).

actuality.verbatim: LOGISTICS SUPPORT: US DLRS 4,902,000 ... UNICEF AIRLIFT ... LIGHT VEHICLES ... FUEL AND LUBRICANTS ... WORKSHOP/OFFICE EQUIPMENT ... SEA TRANSPORT ... WFP AIRLIFT ... PORT EQUIPMENT: GRABS ... DISCHARGE/BAGGING EQUIPMENT ... CONVEYOR BELTS AND ROPES ... PALLETS ... TARPAULINS. NEED FOR CRANES UNDER REVIEW.
actuality.normalized: Logistics unmet needs US$4,902,000 covering UNICEF airlifts (482k), light vehicles (344k), fuel/lubricants (80k), workshop/office equipment (120k), sea transport (1,320k), WFP airlift (201k), and port equipment: grabs (80k), discharge/bagging (2,000k), conveyors/ropes (100k), pallets (40k), tarpaulins (135k); crane needs under review.

actuality.verbatim: HEALTH: US DLRS 3,602,000. REHABILITATION/RE-EQUIPPING OF BASIC HEALTH FACILITIES (US DLRS 3,352,000), STRENGTHENING HEALTH SECTOR EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT (US 250,000).
actuality.normalized: Health unmet needs total US$3,602,000: basic facility rehab/re-equipping (US$3,352,000) and strengthening emergency management (US$250,000).

actuality.verbatim: WATER: US DLRS 5,620,000. TUBEWELL CONSTRUCTION AND RECOVERY, MANICA AND SOFALA (US DLRS 645,000), STRENGTHENING CENTRAL MANAGEMENT CAPACITY (US DLRS 600,000), DRINKING WATER BOREHOLE DRILLING AND RECOVERY IN RURAL AREAS TETE PROVINCE (US DLRS 3,200,000), RECOVERY TETE CITY WATER SUPPLY (US DLRS 600,000), CHEMICAL SUPPORT FOR SAFE DRINKING WATER (US DLRS 575,000).
actuality.normalized: Water unmet needs total US$5,620,000: Manica/Sofala tubewells (US$645k), central management strengthening (US$600k), Tete rural boreholes (US$3,200k), Tete city water recovery (US$600k), chemicals for potabilization (US$575k).

actuality.verbatim: RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS: US DLRS 4,985,000  BLANKETS, CLOTHING, COOKING UTENSILS, SHOES, SOAP.
actuality.normalized: Relief & survival items unmet needs: US$4,985,000 for blankets, clothing, cooking utensils, shoes, and soap.

actuality.verbatim: AGRICULTURAL INPUTS: US DLRS 8,448,000 HANDTOOLS (US DLRS 5,170,000), SEEDS (US DLRS 2,408,000), PESTICIDES (US DLRS 100,000), DISTRIBUTION AND TEMPORARY STORAGE COSTS (US DLRS 770,000).
actuality.normalized: Agricultural inputs unmet needs: US$8,448,000—handtools (US$5,170,000), seeds (US$2,408,000), pesticides (US$100,000), distribution & temporary storage (US$770,000).

actuality.verbatim: GOVT SEEKING CONTRIBUTIONS IN KIND TOWARDS NEWLY ESTABLISHED EMERGENCY EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL STOCKPILE (INITIALLY IN MAPUTO) ... TO BE MADE AVAILABLE IMMEDIATELY UPON REQUEST TO NEEDY GROUPS OF POPULATION ...
actuality.normalized: Government establishes an emergency equipment and material stockpile (initially in Maputo) and seeks in-kind contributions to enable immediate response for displaced/destitute and disaster victims.

actuality.verbatim: ITEMS REQUESTED INCLUDE CANNED FOOD, HIGH PROTEIN BISCUITS, BLANKETS, SHELTER MATERIALS, TENTS, MEDICINES AND MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, CLOTHING, HOUSEHOLD EQUIPMENT, AGRICULTURAL TOOLS, EDUCATION MATERIALS, GENERATORS (FULL LIST AVAILABLE WITH UNSCERO AND UNDRO).
actuality.normalized: Requested in-kind items for the stockpile include foods, shelter materials, medicines/medical equipment, clothing, household equipment, agricultural tools, education materials, and generators (full list at UNSCERO/UNDRO).

actuality.verbatim: COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF REPS FROM GOVERNMENT, DONORS, UN AND NGOS BEING SET UP TO REVIEW REQUESTS FOR FUND'S RESOURCES AND LATTER'S USE.
actuality.normalized: A joint committee (Government, donors, UN, NGOs) is being established to review requests and oversee use of stockpile resources.

actuality.verbatim: STOCKPILE TO BE ADMINISTERED BY DEPARTMENT OF PREVENTION AND COMBAT OF NATURAL DISASTERS (DPCCN).
actuality.normalized: DPCCN designated to administer the emergency stockpile.

actuality.verbatim: CONTRIBUTIONS TO BE ADDRESSED TO: COMMISSAO EXECUTIVA NACIONAL DE EMERGENCIA (CENE) - GABINETE DE OPERACOES DE EMERGENCIA, ATT: VICE MINISTER RATILAL, TEL. 74-36-72, TELEX 6-636.
actuality.normalized: Contributions for the stockpile should be addressed to CENE – Emergency Operations Office, Attn: Vice Minister Ratilal (Tel. 74-36-72; Telex 6-636).

actuality.verbatim: BY END JULY WFP WILL HAVE AIRLIFTED 765 MT FOOD AND NON-FOOD COMMODITIES TO SIX LOCATIONS IN SOFALA PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: By end-July 1987, WFP will have airlifted 765 MT of food and NFIs to six locations in Sofala Province.

actuality.verbatim: IN MARCH 1987, UNHCR ISSUED A SPECIAL APPEAL FOR THE PROVISION OF LIMITED ASSISTANCE FOR ONE YEAR TO 15,000 MOZAMBICAN RETURNEES, MOSTLY FROM MALAWI. THE APPEAL COVERED BASIC REQUIREMENTS FOR FOOD, HOUSEHOLD ITEMS, CLOTHES, SANITATION, WATER, SHELTER, HEALTH, AGRICULTURAL IMPLEMENTS AND TRANSPORT. THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENT FOR SUCH ASSISTANCE WAS INITIALLY ESTIMATED AT US DLRS 1.2 MILLION BUT THIS BUDGET IS AT PRESENT BEING UPDATED.
actuality.normalized: UNHCR (March 1987) issued a one-year appeal to assist 15,000 Mozambican returnees—covering food, NFIs, WASH, shelter, health, ag implements, and transport—initially costed at US$1.2M (budget under update).

actuality.verbatim: THE RETURNEES ARE SETTLED IN THREE RECEPTION CENTRES IN THE DISTRICT OF MOATIZE IN TETE PROVINCE, RESPECTIVELY 5,000 IN MOATIZE SITE 1, 1,800 IN MOATIZE SITE 2 AND 1,800 IN BENGA. FURTHERMORE, SOME 7,000 TO 8,000 RETURNEES ARE ESTIMATED TO BE IN ZOBUE, A BORDER TOWN WITH MALAWI.
actuality.normalized: Returnees accommodated: Moatize Site 1 (5,000), Site 2 (1,800), Benga (1,800); plus ~7,000–8,000 in Zobue (Malawi border).

actuality.verbatim: A RETURNEES GROUP OF 1,281 PREVIOUSLY SETTLED IN BENGA WAS TRANSFERRED TO THEIR PREVIOUS AREA OF RESIDENCE IN MAPUTO BY AIRLIFT FROM 16 MAY TO 23 MAY 1987. THIS WILL ALLOW FOR TRANSFER OF SOME OF THE RETURNEES AT PRESENT LIVING UNDER DEPLORABLE CONDITIONS IN SITE 1 AND SITE 2 IN MOATIZE TO BENGA, WHERE ADDITIONAL SHELTHER IS BEING CONSTRUCTED.
actuality.normalized: 1,281 returnees airlifted 16–23 May 1987 from Benga to former homes in Maputo; capacity freed to move Moatize Site 1/2 residents to Benga where extra shelter is being built.

actuality.verbatim: FOLLOWING ITS APPEAL UNHCR HAS SO FAR RECEIVED CONTRIBUTIONS UP TO US DLRS 1,321,131 FROM GOVERNMENTS OF CANADA, GERMANY FED REP, SWITZERLAND AND UNITED KINGDOM.
actuality.normalized: UNHCR has received US$1,321,131 from Canada, FRG, Switzerland and the UK toward the appeal.

actuality.verbatim: MEDICAL OFFICER BEING PROVIDED TO WHO REPRESENTATIVE'S OFFICE IN MAPUTO. ADDITIONAL TECHNICAL ADVICE WILL BE GIVEN TO GOVERNMENT IN HEALTH INFORMATION SUPPORT AND IN MONITORING OF HEALTH SITUATION.
actuality.normalized: WHO to post a Medical Officer to Maputo and provide technical advice on health information support and situation monitoring.
actuality.outcome: WHO presence and advisory support strengthened

actuality.verbatim: AN AMOUNT OF USD 700,000 IS STILL REQUIRED FOR CARRYING OUT MEDICAL/NUTRITIONAL PROGRAMME IN INHAMBANE PROVINCE UP TO JUNE 1988.
actuality.normalized: MSF (Belgium) still needs US$700,000 to continue the Inhambane medical/nutritional programme through June 1988.

actuality.verbatim: IN CONTEXT ITS EMERGENCY PROGRAMME ZAMBEZIA, SAVE THE CHILDREN/UK CONTRIBUTING, TOGETHER WITH UNDRO, TO UPGRADING QUELIMANE PORT THROUGH THE PROVISION OF CABLES, ROPES, OILS AND LUBRICANTS.
actuality.normalized: Save the Children/UK, with UNDRO, is upgrading Quelimane port by supplying cables, ropes, oils and lubricants.

actuality.verbatim: FROM AUGUST 1987 THROUGH 1989, WORLD VISION INTENDS SUPPLY AGRICULTURAL INPUTS (AGPACKS: FOOD, SEEDS, HANDTOOLS) AND TRAINING TO 25,000 DISPLACED FAMILIES IN TETE AND ZAMBEZIA. WORLD VISION UNDERTAKING FUND-RAISING EFFORTS TO FINANCE THIS PROGRAMME: VALUE US DLRS 2,930,500. SPARE PARTS SHALL ALSO BE PROVIDED FOR IRRIGATION PUMPS IN TETE PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: World Vision plans (Aug 1987–1989) to provide ag-packs (food, seeds, handtools) and training to 25,000 displaced families in Tete and Zambezia; fundraising target US$2,930,500; spare parts for irrigation pumps in Tete also included.

actuality.verbatim: CONTRIBUTIONS REPORTED TO UNDRO SINCE SITREP NO. 6 OF 23 JUNE 1987 AMOUNT TO US DLRS 4,824,000 OF WHICH: - US DLRS 1,529,000 FROM GOVERNMENTS ... - US DLRS 1,365,000 FROM UN SYSTEM ... - US DLRS 626,000 FROM RED CROSS SOCIETIES ... - US DLRS 1,304,000 FROM OTHER NGOS ...
actuality.normalized: Since Sitrep No. 6 (23 June 1987), reported contributions total US$4,824,000: Governments US$1,529,000; UN system US$1,365,000; Red Cross societies US$626,000; other NGOs US$1,304,000.

actuality.verbatim: TOTAL EMERGENCY RELIEF CONTRIBUTIONS REPORTED TO UNDRO SINCE 1 JANUARY 1987 AMOUNT TO US DLRS 222,237,000 AS FOLLOWS: - GOVERNMENTS AND EEC:US DLRS 198,225,000 ... UN SYSTEM US DLRS 9,586,000 RED CROSS SOCIETIES US DLRS 1,640,000 OTHER NGOS US DLRS 12,786,000
actuality.normalized: Total contributions reported since 1 Jan 1987: US$222,237,000 (Governments+EEC US$198,225,000; UN system US$9,586,000; Red Cross societies US$1,640,000; other NGOs US$12,786,000).

actuality.verbatim: DONORS ARE REQUESTED TO INFORM UNDRO DIRECTLY, PREFERABLY BY TELEX (28148 UNDR CH), WITH COPY UNSCERO/MAPUTO (TELEX 6364 UNDEV), OF THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS AND VALUE.
actuality.normalized: Donors should telex UNDRO (28148 UNDR CH), copying UNSCERO/Maputo (6364 UNDEV), with details and values of contributions.

actuality.verbatim: REBEL ATTACKS LAUNCHED IN GAZA, INHAMBANE, SOFALA PROVINCES, AND IN PARTICULAR NIASSA PROVINCE WHERE WERE HIT TOWN MANDIMBA (ENTRY POINT FROM MALAWI) AND ROADS LINKING NIASSA WITH OTHER PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: Rebel attacks reported in Gaza, Inhambane, Sofala, and especially Niassa, hitting Mandimba (Malawi entry point) and inter-provincial roads.

actuality.verbatim: ASSESSMENT MISSION ... IN CITY OF MANDIMBA DESTRUCTION OF STORAGE INFRASTRUCTURE, TRUCKS CONTAINING FUEL, 500 MT WFP MAIZE, 30 MT SCHOOL MATERIAL. ROAD BETWEEN TOWNS MANDIMBA AND LICHINGA NEEDS REPAIR ... RAILWAY CONNECTION FROM MALAWI THROUGH ENTRELAGOS IS IN POOR CONDITION.
actuality.normalized: Mission found in Mandimba: destroyed storage, fuel trucks, 500 MT WFP maize and 30 MT school materials lost; Mandimba–Lichinga road requires repair; Entrelagos rail link from Malawi in poor condition.

actuality.verbatim: DPCCN HAS AIRLIFTED 60 MT FOOD FROM NAMPULA TO LICHINGA.
actuality.normalized: DPCCN airlifted 60 MT of food from Nampula to Lichinga (Niassa).

actuality.verbatim: OXFAM/UK CONTINUES AIRLIFT (SO FAR 1,600 MT FOOD AND RELIEF SUPPLIES) STARTED IN MAY FROM CUAMBA TO MAUA, METARICA AND NIPEPE.
actuality.normalized: Oxfam/UK airlift from Cuamba to Maua, Metarica and Nipepe has delivered ~1,600 MT (food and relief) since May.

actuality.verbatim: FOR MONTHS AUG/SEPT 12,286 MT FOOD DESTINED TO NIASSA (DONORS: WFP, EEC, AUSTRALIA, GERMANY FED REP, NETHERLANDS, UK, OXFAM).
actuality.normalized: Planned for Aug–Sep: 12,286 MT of food to Niassa from WFP, EEC, Australia, FRG, Netherlands, UK, and Oxfam.

actuality.verbatim: FOR CITY MANDIMBA ARE REQUIRED 750 M3 FUEL FOR TRUCKS (200 M3 PLEDGED BY OXFAM), WAREHOUSES (2 WAREHOUSES PLEDGED BY OXFAM, 5 STORAGE TENTS PLEDGED BY UNDRO), SCHOOL MATERIAL (PLEDGED BY UNICEF).
actuality.normalized: Mandimba needs: 750 m³ truck fuel (200 m³ pledged by Oxfam), warehouses (2 by Oxfam) and 5 storage tents (UNDRO), plus school materials (UNICEF).

actuality.verbatim: GOVT PREPARING MILITARY CONVOYS TO PERMIT FOOD TRANSPORT FROM MALAWI THROUGH MANDIMBA TO LICHINGA.
actuality.normalized: Government preparing military convoys to enable food transport Malawi→Mandimba→Lichinga.

actuality.verbatim: ONE-WEEK WFP/UNDRO EMERGENCY MISSION IN EARLY SEPT WILL STUDY POSSIBILITY TO ORGANIZE BOAT TRANSPORT ON LAKE NIASSA OUT OF SOUTH TANZANIA.
actuality.normalized: A one-week WFP/UNDRO mission (early Sept) will assess organizing boat transport on Lake Niassa from southern Tanzania.

actuality.verbatim: GOVT WILL CARRY OUT TWO-WEEK SURVEY WITH UNDRO AIRCRAFT IN ALL PROVINCES OF AVAILABLE SEED STOCKS AND PREPARE REALLOCATION TO DISPLACED POPULATION.
actuality.normalized: Government, using UNDRO aircraft, will conduct a two-week nationwide seed stock survey and plan reallocations to displaced populations.

actuality.verbatim: 12-18 AUG NATIONAL EMERGENCY COORDINATION MEETING IN TETE PROVINCE FOR ALL PROVINCIAL EMERGENCY COMMISSIONS, CHAIRED BY VICE MINISTER RATILAL AND WITH PARTICIPATION AT LAST SESSION OF INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES (OFFICE UN SPECIAL COORDINATOR/MAPUTO, UNDRO, UNICEF, NETHERLANDS, SWEDEN, UK, CARE, SAVE THE CHILDREN/UK AND USA FOR AFRICA).
actuality.normalized: National emergency coordination meeting (Tete, 12–18 Aug) chaired by Vice-Minister Ratilal with broad UN/donor/NGO participation.

actuality.verbatim: VISITS WERE PAID TO INTER ALIA RECEPTION CENTRE IN MOATIZE AND ESTIMA VALLEY RESETTLEMENT AREA.
actuality.normalized: Delegates visited Moatize reception centre and Estima Valley resettlement area.

actuality.verbatim: MASTER PLAN FOR PROVINCIAL EMERGENCY RELIEF WAS APPROVED.
actuality.normalized: Master plan for provincial emergency relief approved.

actuality.verbatim: A FOOD AND NON-FOOD NEEDS ASSESSMENT QUESTIONNAIRE WAS ADOPTED. ONCE DISTRICT LEVEL SURVEY MADE WITH QUESTIONNAIRE, RESULTS WILL BE RELEASED BY CENTRAL EMERGENCY CABINET.
actuality.normalized: Food/non-food needs assessment questionnaire adopted; district survey results to be released by the Central Emergency Cabinet.

actuality.verbatim: (I) FREE FOOD DISTRIBUTION SHOULD BE CARRIED OUT ONLY DURING A FIXED PERIOD WITHIN A DEFINED AREA. MEANS TO RESTART PRODUCTIVE LIFE SHOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
actuality.normalized: Policy (i): Free food distribution time- and area-limited; support to restart productive livelihoods should follow quickly.

actuality.verbatim: (II) DPCCN SHOULD DEAL WITH DISTRIBUTION TO AFFECTED PEOPLE. MINISTRY OF COMMERCE HANDLES DISTRIBUTION TO MARKET.
actuality.normalized: Policy (ii): DPCCN distributes to affected populations; Ministry of Commerce manages market distribution.

actuality.verbatim: (III) AFTER MAXIMUM SIX-MONTH PERIOD OF RELIEF ASSISTANCE, DISPLACED PERSONS SHOULD BEGIN ACTUAL PROCESS OF REINSTALLATION.
actuality.normalized: Policy (iii): Relief capped at six months, after which displaced persons should begin reinstallation.

actuality.verbatim: RESETTLEMENT TO ESTIMA VALLEY OF PEOPLE LIVING IN RAILWAY CARS IN MOATIZE WILL SOON BE LAUNCHED.
actuality.normalized: Planned launch: resettle Moatize railway-car residents to Estima Valley.

actuality.verbatim: UNICEF AND USA FOR AFRICA HAVE RECEIVED REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE TO THIS RESETTLEMENT OPERATION.
actuality.normalized: Assistance requests for the Estima resettlement sent to UNICEF and USA for Africa.

actuality.verbatim: FURTHER TO ITALIAN GOVT PLEDGE ... TWO ITALIAN SHIPMENTS OF RICE, CLOTH, SUGAR, VEHICLES AND EQUIPMENT, SOAP, LYOPHILIZED FOOD, FAMILY KITS, OIL, VALUED 12.1 BILLION LIRE (US DLRS 9,236,641) WERE DELIVERED IN AUGUST TO PORTS OF BEIRA AND MAPUTO.

MISSION WILL END LATE DECEMBER 1987, ITS MAIN TASKS ARE: A) STREAMLINE DATA ON FOOD AID AND OTHER DONATIONS, B) ELABORATE COMPUTER PROGRAMMES FOR THE PRODUCTION OF REPORTS, C) TRAIN GOVERNMENT COMPUTER PERSONNEL.

actuality.normalized: Updated shortfalls: Maize 328,312 MT; Pulses 97,404 MT; Oil 66,784 MT; Sugar 57,229 MT; rice and wheat needs met.

actuality.verbatim: GOVERNMENT AND WFP PROPOSING SUBSTANTIAL STRENGTHENING COASTAL RIVER AND LAKE TRANSPORT TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO AFFECTED/DISPLACED POPULATION FOR DISTRIBUTION OF FOOD AND OTHER ITEMS. ONCE SET UP, NETWORK WILL ENABLE REACH APPROX 4 MILLION PEOPLE, THUS COMPLEMENTING AND OVERCOMING ROAD TRANSPORT LIMITATIONS. FIRST USE OF FUND IS TO PROVIDE FOR REPLACEMENT DESTROYED OR ROBBED HEALTH EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES TO HOMOINE DISTRICT RECENTLY ATTACKED.
actuality.normalized: UNICEF resumes airlift of high-value/low-volume items and sets up a US$50,000 Quick Action Fund; first use: replace stolen/destroyed health equipment in recently attacked Homoine district.

actuality.verbatim: MALAWI/ENTRELAGOS (BY RAIL)/MECANHELAS (BY ROAD). DELIVERY POINT: ENTRELAGOS. TRANSIT FROM ENTRELAGOS TO MECANHELAS POSSIBLE ONLY UNTIL END NOVEMBER, DUE TO START RAINY SEASON (NOVEMBER TO MARCH).
actuality.normalized: Route: Malawi→Entrelagos (rail)→Mecanhelas (road); DP: Entrelagos; passable only until end of November due to rains.

actuality.verbatim: MALAWI/CUAMBA/LICHINGA (BY RAIL) /METARICA/MAUA/N'GAUMA (BY ROAD). DELIVERY POINT: CUAMBA. NEED TO REBUILD BRIDGE OVER LULEIO RIVER. IN ANY CASE, TRANSIT FROM CUAMBA TO METARICA AND MAUA POSSIBLE ONLY UNTIL END NOVEMBER.
actuality.normalized: Route: Malawi→Cuamba→Lichinga (rail), then Metarica/Maua/N'gauma (road); DP: Cuamba. Bridge over Luleio River must be rebuilt; road transit only until end-November.

actuality.normalized: Route: Malawi→Mandimba→Lichinga (road); DP: Mandimba; requires 150 km rehab incl. 7 bridges; usable only until end-November.

actuality.verbatim: LATEST TOLL OF ATTACKS: ON 16 OCT AT TANINGA (80 KM NORTH MAPUTO) 53 CASUALTIES INCLUDING MANY CHILDREN, ON 29 OCT IN ABOUT SAME AREA 278 CIVILIANS KILLED OF WHOM MAJORITY WERE WOMEN AND CHILDREN. AREA VISITED ON 1 NOV BY UNSCERO, UN AGENCIES, DONOR GOVERNMENTS AND NGOS. MATERIAL LOSSES ESTIMATED APPROX. US DLRS THREE MILLION.
actuality.normalized: Attacks near Taninga: 16 Oct—53 casualties (many children); 29 Oct—278 civilians killed (mostly women/children). Site visited 1 Nov by UNSCERO/UN/donors/NGOs. Estimated material losses ≈US$3M.

actuality.verbatim: CONSIDERABLE DELAYS OF DELIVERY CEREALS (MAINLY MAIZE) FROM ZIMBABWE AFFECTING IN PARTICULAR PROVINCES INHAMBANE, MANICA, SOFALA, TETE. DURING PERIOD MAY/SEPT 87 ONLY 25.6 PERCENT OF MAIZE DELIVERIES FROM ZIMBABWE COULD ARRIVE AS PLANNED. JOINT MISSION WFP/UNDRO/MOZ GOVT TO VISIT HARARE AND BLANTYRE IN ORDER TO MAKE PROPOSALS TO RESOLVE ZIMBABWE SUPPLY BOTTLENECKS.
actuality.normalized: Maize deliveries via Zimbabwe severely delayed—only 25.6% arrived on plan (May–Sep 1987), impacting Inhambane, Manica, Sofala, Tete. Joint WFP/UNDRO/Govt mission to Harare/Blantyre planned to address bottlenecks.

actuality.verbatim: WFP AIRLIFT TO INHAMINGA CARRIED UNTIL NOW 1,090 MT FOOD AND RELIEF GOODS. AIRLIFT FINANCED BY ITALY WILL DELIVER TOTAL 3,900 MT OF RELIEF SUPPLIES DONATED BY ITALY TO PROVINCES MANICA, SOFALA, ZAMBEZIA. ICRC AIRLIFTING 800 MT BEANS TO NORTH SOFALA.
actuality.normalized: WFP Inhaminga airlift to date: 1,090 MT; Italy-financed airlift to deliver a total of 3,900 MT to Manica, Sofala, Zambezia. ICRC airlifting 800 MT beans to North Sofala.

actuality.verbatim: MAPUTO PORT PRODUCTIVITY RISEN FROM 800 TO 1,300 MT.
actuality.normalized: Maputo port productivity increased from 800 to 1,300 MT (initial discharge rate).

actuality.verbatim: ALL EQUIPMENT AND MATERIAL REQUIRED FOR REHABILITATON BEIRA PORT NOT YET ARRIVED.
actuality.normalized: Beira port rehabilitation equipment/materials have not yet fully arrived.

actuality.verbatim: ITALIAN TECHNICIANS WORKING ON IMPROVEMENT QUELIMANE PORT.
actuality.normalized: Italian technicians are working to improve Quelimane port.

actuality.verbatim: TEN CARGO THREE-MT RUBBER BOATS DONATED BY SWEDEN THROUGH WFP BEING USED TO IMPROVE RIVER AND LAKE OPERATION.
actuality.normalized: Sweden (via WFP) donated ten 3-MT cargo rubber boats now used to improve river/lake operations.

actuality.verbatim: NATIONAL EXECUTIVE COMMISSION FOR EMERGENCY (CENE) WILL HOLD NATIONAL MEETING 3-5 DEC IN INHAMBANE WITH PARTICIPATION NATIONAL AND PROVINCIAL DPCCN AND EMERGENCY COMMISSIONS. ... INTERNATIONAL PARTICIPATION WILL BE POSSIBLE ON LAST DAY OF MEETING IN INHAMBANE.
actuality.normalized: CENE national meeting set for 3–5 Dec 1987 in Inhambane with DPCCN/emergency commissions; international participation allowed on final day.

actuality.verbatim: CENE UNIT FOR DIFFUSION OF EMERGENCY INFORMATION PLANS TO PUBLISH DURING EIGHTEEN MONTHS MONTHLY BULLETIN FOR DISTRIBUTION TO INTERNATIONAL DONOR COMMUNITY. COST: US DLRS 103,620 (CONTRIBUTIONS SO FAR: 25,000 BY UNDRO, 5,000 BY SAVE THE CHILDREN, 5,000 BY OXFAM/UK).
actuality.normalized: CENE to publish a monthly emergency bulletin for 18 months (cost US$103,620). Contributions to date: UNDRO US$25,000; Save the Children US$5,000; Oxfam/UK US$5,000.

actuality.verbatim: HIGH COMMISSIONER'S APPEAL OF MARCH 1987 FOR ASSISTANCE MOZAMBICAN RETURNEES COVERED ASSISTANCE FOR ONE YEAR TO 15,000 MOZAMBICAN RETURNEES WITH INITIAL ESTIMATED BUDGET OF US DLRS 1.2 MILLION. NEW ARRIVALS RETURNEES FROM MALAWI AND ZIMBABWE BRING TOTAL ESTIMATED NUMBER RETURNEES TO APPROX. 42,800.
actuality.normalized: UNHCR’s Mar 1987 appeal budgeted US$1.2M for 15,000 returnees; subsequent arrivals increased estimated caseload to ~42,800.

actuality.verbatim: SINCE SEPTEMBER, RETURNEES PREVIOUSLY LIVING IN ZIMBABWE HAVE SETTLED INPROVINCE MANICA (APPROX. 6,300), MAINLY IN ESPUNGABERA AREA WHERE THEY RECEIVE ASSISTANCE FROM UNICEF AND UNHCR. RETURNEES IN PROVINCES TETE (APPROX. 29,500) AND NIASSA (APPROX. 7,000) CONSIST LARGELY OF PEOPLE PREVIOUSLY RESIDENT IN MALAWI. UNHCR ASSISTANCE TO RETURNEES CURRENTLY BEING REVISED.
actuality.normalized: Since Sep: ~6,300 Zimbabwe-based returnees settled in Manica (Espungabera) with UNICEF/UNHCR assistance; ~29,500 in Tete and ~7,000 in Niassa mainly from Malawi; UNHCR assistance under revision.

actuality.verbatim: NEW REQUIREMENTS ESTIMATED AT US DLRS 1,746,818.
actuality.normalized: Updated funding need estimated at US$1,746,818 for the returnees programme.

actuality.verbatim: RESPONSE TO UNHCR MARCH APPEAL SO FAR TOTALS US DLRS 1,751,696 FROM GOVERNMENTS OF CANADA, FRG, NETHERLANDS, PORTUGAL, SWITZERLAND, UK AND FROM STICHTING VLUCHTELING (NETHERLANDS), PRIVATE DONATIONS (JAPAN).
actuality.normalized: Contributions to UNHCR’s March appeal total US$1,751,696 (Canada, FRG, Netherlands, Portugal, Switzerland, UK; Stichting Vluchteling (NL); private donations from Japan).

actuality.verbatim: FOOD  OCTOBER 1987 - APRIL 1988  MAIZE - 233,700 MT  PULSES - 21,100 MT  SUGAR - 47,800 MT  REQUIREMENTS FOR RICE, WHEAT AND OIL MET. (FOR MORE DETAILS, SEE WFP EMERGENCY TELEX REPORT NO.120 DATED 27 NOVEMBER 1987.)
actuality.normalized: Food needs (Oct 1987–Apr 1988): Maize 233,700 MT; Pulses 21,100 MT; Sugar 47,800 MT. Rice, wheat and oil needs are met. (Ref: WFP Emergency Telex Report No. 120, 27 Nov 1987.)

actuality.verbatim: NON-FOOD  IT IS VERY IMPORTANT TO CONTRIBUTE TO A) WATER TRANSPORT TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO AFFECTED/DISPLACED PEOPLE, B) WATER AND AGRICULTURAL SECTORS PROMOTING SELF-RELIANCE.
actuality.normalized: Priority non-food support: (a) water transport for access to affected/displaced people; (b) water and agricultural sectors to promote self-reliance.

(2) INCLUDING TWO-YEAR REQUIREMENTS FOR STRENGTHENING HEALTH SECTOR EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT.  1/ INCLUDING REQUIREMENTS OF USD 9,105,000 FOR SIX INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN SOFALA, AND ZAMBEZIA (FAO APPEAL OF 22 MAY 1987).
actuality.normalized: Updated non-food requirements by sector (US$): Logistics 12,747,000 (pledged 8,114,000; unmet 4,633,000); Health 8,791,000 (pledged 5,688,000; unmet 3,103,000); Water 5,675,000 (pledged 286,000; unmet 5,389,000); Relief & survival items 6,354,000 (pledged 3,099,000; unmet 3,255,000); Agriculture 18,441,000 (pledged 6,459,000; unmet 11,982,000). Total: 52,008,000 (pledged 23,646,000; unmet 28,362,000). Notes: logistics excludes warehousing estimates and unallocated contributions; health includes two-year emergency management; agriculture includes FAO’s US$9,105,000 for six integrated rural development projects in Sofala and Zambezia.

actuality.verbatim: LOGISTICS SUPPORT: US DLRS 4,633,000  CONTINUATION OF WFP COASTAL OPERATION (USD 750,000). GOVERNMENTAL/WFP PLAN TO STRENGTHEN COASTAL, LAKE AND RIVER TRANSPORT (USD 3 MILLION, UNDRO SITREP NO.9 DATED 29 SEPTEMBER 1987, PARA.8 REFERS). UNICEF REQUIREMENTS FOR AIRLIFT OF LOW VOLUME/HIGH VALUE ITEMS (USD 683,000) AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE/TRAINING TO DPCCN (USD 200,000).
actuality.normalized: Logistics unmet (US$4,633,000): WFP coastal services continuation (US$750,000); Govt/WFP plan to strengthen coastal/lake/river transport (US$3,000,000); UNICEF airlift of low-volume/high-value items (US$683,000) and DPCCN technical assistance/training (US$200,000).
actuality.outcome: Line items for logistics gap detailed

actuality.verbatim: HEALTH: US DLRS 3,103,000  FUNDS ARE REQUIRED FOR REHAB/REEQUIPPING OF BASIC HEALTH FACILITIES AND STRENGTHENING HEALTH SECTOR EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT. UNICEF REQUIREMENTS FOR REHABILITATION FACILITIES AND ASSISTANCE TO VULNERABLE GROUPS AMOUNT ALONE TO US DLRS 3.7 MILLION. GAP OF US DLRS 3.1 MILLION TAKES INTO ACCOUNT OTHER CONTRIBUTIONS TO ACTIVITIES OF NGO'S AND GOVERNMENT IN SAME AREA.
actuality.normalized: Health unmet need: US$3,103,000 for rehabilitating/equipping basic facilities and strengthening emergency management. UNICEF’s own needs total US$3.7M; the US$3.1M gap reflects other NGO/Government contributions in the sector.

actuality.verbatim: REQUIREMENTS FOR VITAL MEDICINES BEING COVERED. MEDICAL NEEDS IN NIASSA COVERED BY UNICEF PROGRAMME ESSENTIAL DRUGS (UNDRO SITREP NO.10 OF 30 OCTOBER 1987, PARA. 6 REFERS). MAIN PROBLEM STILL IS TO ARRANGE DELIVERY TO AFFECTED PROVINCES.
actuality.normalized: Vital medicine needs are covered, including Niassa via UNICEF’s essential drugs programme; primary constraint is arranging deliveries to the affected provinces.
actuality.outcome: Supply coverage confirmed; delivery bottleneck remains

actuality.verbatim: WATER: US DLRS 5,389,000  TUBEWELL CONSTRUCTION AND RECOVERY, SOFALA AND MANICA (USD 645,000). STRENGTHENING NATIONAL WATER AUTHORITY (USD 600,000). BOREHOLE DRILLING AND RECOVERY IN RURAL AREAS, TETE (USD 3,200,000). RECOVERY OF TETE CITY WATER SUPPLY (USD 369,000). CHEMICAL SUPPORT FOR SAFE DRINKING WATER (USD 575,000).
actuality.normalized: Water unmet need (US$5,389,000): tubewells in Sofala/Manica (US$645k); strengthen National Water Authority (US$600k); rural boreholes in Tete (US$3.2M); Tete city supply recovery (US$369k); chemicals for safe water (US$575k).

actuality.verbatim: RELIEF AND SURVIVAL ITEMS: US DLRS 3,255,000 (INCLUDING UNICEF NEEDS OF US DLRS 1.7 MILLION)  DESPITE RECEIPT CONTRIBUTIONS, NOTABLY FROM NGO'S, RECURRENT NEEDS FOR CLOTHING, SOAP, COOKING UTENSILS AND BLANKETS REMAIN ACUTE.
actuality.normalized: Relief & survival unmet need: US$3,255,000 (incl. UNICEF US$1.7M). Despite NGO support, clothing, soap, cooking utensils and blankets remain in acute, recurring demand.

actuality.verbatim: AGRICULTURAL INPUTS: US DLRS 11,982,000  PROVISION AND DELIVERY/DISTRIBUTION OF HANDTOOLS AND SEEDS (USD 3,021,000). PESTICIDES (USD 100,000). SIX INTEGRATED RURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS/FAO APPEAL (USD 8,861,000).
actuality.normalized: Agriculture unmet need (US$11,982,000): seeds and hand tools incl. delivery (US$3,021,000); pesticides (US$100,000); FAO six integrated rural development projects (US$8,861,000).

actuality.verbatim: LWF APPEAL  LWF APPEALS FOR USDLRS 800,000 FOR EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE MAINLY IN PROVINCES INHAMBANE AND SOFALA (FOODSTUFFS, SEEDS, TOOLS, KITCHEN UTENSILS, GENERAL HEALTH ASSISTANCE).
actuality.normalized: Lutheran World Federation appeals for US$800,000 for emergency aid in Inhambane and Sofala (foodstuffs, seeds, tools, kitchen items, general health assistance).

actuality.verbatim: AT MEETING ORGANIZED IN INHAMBANE BY NATIONAL EXECUTIVE COMMISSION FOR EMERGENCY (CENE) (SEE UNDRO SITREP NO. 11 DATED 27 NOVEMBER 87, PARA 5), INCREASED NUMBER OF AFFECTED AND DISPLACED PEOPLE PER PROVINCE WAS PRESENTED. THE NEW FIGURES WILL BE UPDATED AND VALIDATED BY FIELD MISSIONS MADE UP OF REPRESENTATIVES OF GOVT, THE UN SYSTEM (UNICEF, UNDP, UNDRO, WFP), EEC, BILATERAL DONOR GOVERNMENTS (NETHERLANDS, SWEDEN, USA) AND NGOS ACTIVE IN PROVINCES VISITED. MISSIONS INTENDED TO COMMENCE IN THE COURSE OF JANUARY 88.
actuality.normalized: CENE meeting (Inhambane) presented higher per-province figures for affected/displaced persons. Multi-stakeholder field missions (Govt, UN agencies, EEC, NL/SE/US, NGOs) will update/validate the data starting January 1988.
actuality.outcome: Data revision and validation plan set

actuality.verbatim: WFP APPEALING FOR CASH AND/OR KIND CONTRIBUTIONS TO MEET REQUIREMENTS TOTALLING USD 3,970,000 FOR:  AAA) CONTINUATION OF COASTAL SERVICES BY UP TO TWO VESSELS TO END 1988 (40,000 MT AT USD 30 PER MT = USD 1,200,000). BBB) REHABILITATION OF THIRTEEN 20 TO 60 MT BOATS TO STRENGTHEN COASTAL TRANSPORT (USD 300,000). CCC) PROVISION OF NINE BARGES AND THREE WORKBOATS/TUGS FOR DISCHARGING OPERATIONS (USD 2,220,000). DDD) REPAIR OF THREE 120 MT MOTORIZED SHALLOW DRAFT BARGES FOR RIVER TRANSPORT (USD 250,000).
actuality.normalized: WFP appeals for US$3,970,000: (A) continue coastal services (≤2 vessels) through 1988 (40,000 MT @ US$30/MT = US$1.2M); (B) rehabilitate 13 boats (20–60 MT) (US$300k); (C) provide 9 barges + 3 workboats/tugs for discharging (US$2.22M); (D) repair three 120-MT shallow-draft river barges (US$250k).

actuality.verbatim: WITH CANADIAN FUNDS, UNDRO IS GRANTING USD 250,000 TOWARDS CONTINUATION COASTAL SERVICES IN EARLY 1988 (POINT AAA ABOVE).
actuality.normalized: UNDRO, using Canadian funds, grants US$250,000 to continue coastal services in early 1988 (component AAA).

actuality.verbatim: JOINT WFP/UNDRO MISSIONS CARRIED OUT IN IN ZAMBEZIA PROVINCE AND IN ZIMBABWE/TETE PROVINCE/MALAWI. THE MISSION TO ZAMBEZIA FOCUSED ON THE CHANNELS OF TRANSPORT(COAST,RIVER,RAILWAY,AIR). THE SECOND MISSION (SEE UNDRO SITREP NO. 11 DATED 27 NOV 87, PARA 2) CONTACTED AUTHORITIES CONCERNED TO IMPROVE DELIVERY OF MAIZE TO PROVINCES OF NIASSA AND TETE. REPORTS ARE AVAILABLE WITH UNDRO.
actuality.normalized: Joint WFP/UNDRO missions: Zambezia mission reviewed coast/river/rail/air channels; second mission engaged authorities in Zimbabwe/Malawi to improve maize deliveries to Niassa and Tete. Reports available with UNDRO.

actuality.verbatim: CEMENT BRIDGE (LENGTH:275 M) OVER INCOMATI RIVER BUILT AT MOAMBA (MAPUTO PROVINCE) WITH ITALIAN CONTRIBUTION OF USD 2.9 MILLION THROUGH UNDRO WAS INAUGURATED ON 5 DECEMBER 1987. BRIDGE, WHICH WILL FACILITATE DISTRIBUTION OF RELIEF SUPPLIES AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AID PROJECTS IN REGION, WAS COMPLETED UNDER UNDRO SUPERVISION IN TWENTY MONTHS (TEN MONTHS AHEAD OF SCHEDULE).
actuality.normalized: Moamba (Incomati River) 275-m cement bridge, funded by Italy via UNDRO (US$2.9M), inaugurated 5 Dec 1987; completed in 20 months (10 months ahead). It will facilitate relief distribution and project implementation in the region.
actuality.outcome: Key logistics bridge delivered ahead of schedule

actuality.verbatim: MSF BELGIUM REQUIRING URGENTLY USD 400,000 TO COMPLETE REHABILITATION PROGRAMME OF SANITARY NETWORK NORTH INHAMBANE PROVINCE.
actuality.normalized: MSF Belgium urgently requires US$400,000 to complete rehabilitation of the sanitary network in northern Inhambane Province.
